transliteration:
atha manonmanī[^78]
mārute madhyasaṃcāre manaḥsthairyaṃ prajāyate |
yo manaḥsusthirībhāvaḥ saivāvasthā manonmanī || 2.42 ||
translation_danish:
[2.42] Når åndedrættet bevæger sig i midten, stilnes sindet. Denne
behagelige tilstand af sindsro er Manonmanī-stadiet.[^79]
translation_english: [2.42-43] To accomplish it, various Kumbhakas are performed by those who are expert in the methods; for, by the practice of different Kumbhakas, wonderful success is attained.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^79]: Manonmanī-stadiet er en tilstand af fuldstændig sinds- og kropsro samt dybdekoncentration, hvor al opmærksomhed rettes mod et enkelt punkt (ekāgratā). Tilstanden er bevidst i modsætning til Unmanī-stadiet (jf. 4.39, 4.47, 4.61, 4.104, 4.106). Andetsteds siges de dog at være synonymer (4.3-4). Manonmanī kan tilnærmelsesvis oversættes med "sindet hinsides sindet".
footnotes_transliteration: [^78]: Denne kommentar forekommer ikke i Lonāvlā-versionen af Haṭhapradīpikā, men er alligevel medtaget her for klarhedens skyld i overensstemmelse med GRETIL.

sanskrit:
तत्सिद्धये विधानज्ञाश्चित्रान्कुर्वन्ति कुम्भकान् ।
विचित्रकुम्भकाभ्यासाद्विचित्रां सिद्धिमाप्नुयात् ॥४३॥
transliteration:
tatsiddhaye vidhānajñāś citrān kurvanti kumbhakān |
vicitra kumbhakābhyāsād vicitrāṃ siddhim āpnuyāt || 2.43 ||
translation_danish:
[2.43] De, som er vidende om fremgangsmåden, vil udføre alverdens
kumbhakaer for at opnå dette. Ved at udføre alverdens kumbhakaer opnås
talrige siddhier.[^80]
Dette er kumbhakaerne:
translation_english: NA

sanskrit:
अथ कुम्भकभेदाः
सूर्यभेदनमुज्जायी सीत्कारी शीतली तथा ।
भस्त्रिका भ्रामरी मूर्च्छा प्लाविनीत्यष्टकुम्भकाः ॥४४॥
transliteration:
atha kumbhakabhedāḥ
sūryabhedanam ujjāyī sītkārī śītalī tathā |
bhastrikā bhrāmarī mūrcchā plāvinīty aṣṭakumbhakāḥ || 2.44 ||
translation_danish:
[2.44] Følgende er de otte kumbhakaer: Sūryabhedana, Ujjāyī, Sītkārī,
Śītalī, Bhastrikā, Bhrāmarī, Mūrcchā og Plāvinī.[^81]
translation_english: [2.44] Kumbhakas are of eight kinds, viz., Sūrya Bhedan, Ujjāyī, Sītkarī, Sītalī, Bhastrikā, Bhrāmarī, Mūrchhā, and Plāvinī.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^81]: Termerne for kumbhakaerne kan tentativt oversættes som Sūryabhedana-kumbhaka, 'Den solsplittende kumbhaka', Ujjayī-kumbhaka,'Den sejrrige kumbhaka', Sītkārī,'Kumbhakaen, der frembringer lyden sīt', Śītalī, 'Den kølende kumbhaka', Bhastrikā, 'Den lille blæsebælgskumbhaka', Bhrāmarī, 'Kumbhakaen, der frembringer lyden af en humlebi', Mūrchā eller Mūrcchā, 'Den bedøvende kumbhaka', og Plāvinī, 'Den overstrømmende kumbhaka'.

sanskrit:
पूरकान्ते तु कर्तव्यो बन्धो जालन्धराभिधः ।
कुम्भकान्ते रेचकादौ कर्तव्यस्तूड्डियानकः ॥४५॥
transliteration:
pūrakānte tu kartavyo bandho jālandharābhidhaḥ |
kumbhakānte recakādau kartavyas tūḍḍiyānakaḥ || 2.45 ||
translation_danish:
[2.45] Ved indåndingens afslutning udføres bandhaen ved navn
Jālandhara. Ved kumbhakaens[^82] afslutning og påbegyndelsen af
udåndingen udføres Uḍḍiyānabandha.[^83]
translation_english: [2.45] At the end of Pūraka, Jālandhara Bandha should be performed, and at the end of Kumbhaka, and at the beginning of Rechaka, Uddiyāna Bandha should be performed. [2.45] Kumbhaka is the keeping the air confined inside. Rechaka is expelling the confined air. The instructions for Puraka, Kumbhaka and Rechaka will be found at their proper place and should he carefully followed.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^82]: Kumbhaka er en særlig åndedrætsteknik, hvor man lukker næsen med højre hånd og holder vejret, hvorved man omdanner lungerne til en 'krukke' eller 'gryde' (kumbhaka) af luft.
[^83]: Uḍḍiyāna-bandha, 'Mavelåsen'.

sanskrit:
अधस्तात्कुञ्चनेनाशु कण्ठसंकोचने कृते ।
मध्ये पश्चिमतानेन स्यात्प्राणो ब्रह्मनाडिगः ॥४६॥
transliteration:
adhastāt kuñcanenāśu kaṇṭhasaṅkocane kr̥te |
madhye paścimatānena syāt prāṇo brahmanāḍigaḥ || 2.46 ||
translation_danish:
[2.46] Når man hurtigt sammentrækker struben, spænder forneden og
trækker sammen i midten med Paścimatānāsana,[^84] vil prāṇa
gennemstrømme Brahman-kanalen.[^85]
translation_english: [2.46] By drawing up from below (Mūla Bandha) and contracting the throat (Jālandhara Bandha) and by pulling back the middle of the front portion of the body (i.e., belly), the Prāṇa goes to the Brahma Nādī (Suṣumnā). [NOTE3]
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^84]: Se 1.28-29.
[^85]: Brahma-nāḍī, 'Brahman-kanalen', dvs. kanalen, som fører til brahman (det upersonlige absolutte i modsætning til den mandlige skabergud Brahmā). Brahmanāḍī er synonym for Suṣumnā-kanalen.

sanskrit:
अपानमूर्ध्वमुत्थाप्य प्रणं कण्ठादधो नयेत् ।
योगी जराविमुक्तः सन्षोडशाब्दव​या भवेत् ॥४७॥
transliteration:
āpānam ūrdhvam utthāpya prāṇaṃ kaṇṭhād adho nayet |
yogī jarāvimuktaḥ san ṣoḍaśābdavayā bhavet || 2.47 ||
translation_danish:
[2.47] Man fører apānaen opad og prāṇaen fra struben og nedad. Yogien,
som har overvundet døden, bliver som en spændstig 16-årig.
Dette er Sūryabhedanakumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.47] By pulling up the Apāna Vāyu and by forcing the Prāṇa Vāyu down the throat, the Yogī, liberated from old age, becomes young, as it were 16 years old. [4]

sanskrit:
अध सूर्यभेदनम्
आसने सुखदे योगी बद्ध्वा चैवासनं ततः ।
दक्षनाड्या समाकृष्य बहिस्थं पवनं शनैः ॥४८॥
transliteration:
atha sūryabhedanam
āsane sukhade yogī baddhvā caivāsanaṃ tataḥ |
dakṣanāḍyā samākr̥ṣya bahisthaṃ pavanaṃ śanaiḥ || 2.48 ||
translation_danish:
[2.48-49] Når yogien har holdt kumbhakaen så længe som muligt mellem
hårtoppen og tåspidsen, bør han indtage en behagelig āsana. Han skal
fastholde denne og trække luft udefra forsigtigt ind gennem højre
kanal[^86] og ånde forsigtigt ud gennem venstre kanal.[^87]
translation_english: [2.48] Taking any comfortable posture and performing the āsana, the Yogī should draw in the air slowly, through the right nostril.

sanskrit:
आकेशादानखाग्राच्च निरोधावधि कुम्भयेत् ।
ततः शनैः सव्यनाड्या रेचयेत्पवनं शनैः ॥४९॥
transliteration:
ākeśād ānakhāgrāc ca nirodhāvadhi kumbhayet |
tataḥ śanaiḥ savyanāḍyā recayet pavanaṃ śanaiḥ || 2.49 ||
translation_danish: NA
translation_english: [2.49] Then it should be confined within, so that it fills from the nails to the tips of the hair, and then let out through the left nostril slowly. [5]

sanskrit:
कपालशोधनं वातदोषघ्नं कृमिदोषहृत् ।
पुनः पुनरिदं कार्यं सूर्यभेदनमुत्तमम् ॥५०॥
transliteration:
kapālaśodhanaṃ vātadoṣaghnaṃ kr̥midoṣahr̥t |
punaḥ punar idaṃ kāryaṃ sūryabhedanam uttamam || 2.50 ||
translation_danish:
[2.50] Yogien bør gentage denne Sūryabhedana, den ypperste
åndedrætsøvelse, som renser kraniet, helbreder luftvejssygdomme og
bekæmper indvoldsorm.
Dette er Ujjayīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.50] This excellent Sūrya Bhedana cleanses the forehead (frontal sinuses), destroys the disorders of Vāta, and removes the worms, and, therefore, it should be performed again and again. [6]

sanskrit:
अथोज्जायी
मुखं संयम्य नाडीभ्यामाकृष्य पवनं शनैः ।
यथा ल​गति कण्ठात्तु हृदयावधि सस्वनम् ॥५१॥
transliteration:
athojjāyī
mukhaṃ saṃyamya nāḍībhyām ākr̥ṣya pavanaṃ śanaiḥ |
yathā lagati kaṇṭhāt tu hr̥dayāvadhi sasvanam || 2.51 ||
translation_danish:
[2.51] Man lukker munden og trækker vejret roligt via de to
nādīer,[^88] således at der opstår lyd fra halsen til hjertet.
translation_english: [2.51] Having closed the opening of the Nādī (Larynx), the air should be drawn in such a way that it goes touching from the throat to the chest, and making noise while passing.

sanskrit:
पूर्ववत्कुम्भयेत्प्राणं रेचयेदिडया ततः ।
श्लेष्मदोषहरं कण्ठे दहानलविवर्धनम् ॥५२॥
transliteration:
pūrvavat kumbhayet prāṇaṃ recayed iḍayā tathā |
śleṣmadoṣaharaṃ kaṇṭhe dehānalavivardhanam || 2.52 ||
translation_danish:
[2.52] Som tidligere beskrevet,[^89] bør yogien fastholde prāṇaen i en
kumbhaka, og derefter ånde ud via Iḍā. Slim og sygdomme i halsen fjernes
og kroppens forbrænding øges.
translation_english: [2.52] It should be restrained, as before, and then let out through Idā (the left nostril). This removes śleṣmā (phlegm) in the throat and increases the appetite.

sanskrit:
नाडीजलोदराधातुगतदोषविनाशनम् ।
गच्छता तिष्ठ​ता कार्यमुज्जाय्याख्यं तु कुम्भकम् ॥५३॥
transliteration:
nāḍījalodarādhātugatadoṣavināśanam |
gacchatā tiṣṭhatā kāryam ujjāyy ākhyaṃ tu kumbhakam || 2.53 ||
translation_danish:
[2.53] Således forsvinder væske i nādīerne, luft i maven og sygdomme i
kroppens elementer fjernes. Denne kumbhaka, som skal gøres stående eller
gående, kaldes Ujjāyī.
Dette er Sītkārīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.53] It destroys the defects of the nādīs, dropsy and disorders of Dhātu (humours). Ujjāyī should be performed in all conditions of life, even while walking or sitting.

sanskrit:
अथ सीत्कारी
सीत्कां कुर्यात्तथा वक्त्रे घ्रणेनैव विजृम्भिकाम् ।
एवमभ्यासयोगेन कामदेवो द्वितीयकः ॥५४॥
transliteration:
atha sītkārī
sītkāṃ kuryāt tathā vaktre ghrāṇenaiva vijr̥mbhikām |
evam abhyāsayogena kāmadevo dvitīyakaḥ || 2.54 ||
translation_danish:
[2.54] Yogien bør trække vejret voldsomt ind gennem næsen, ned i
munden og derved frembringe lyden 'sīt'. Ved at praktisere yoga på denne
måde bliver han en ny Kāmadeva.[^90]
translation_english: [2.54] Sītkārī is performed by drawing in the air through the mouth, keeping the tongue between the lips. The air thus drawn in should not be expelled through the mouth. By practising in this way, one becomes next to the God of Love in beauty.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^90]: Kāmadeva, 'Kærlighedens gud', er guden for lidenskab, kærlighed og sex, der ofte identificeres med guden Śiva.

sanskrit:
योगिनीचक्रसम्मान्यः सृष्टिसंहारकारकः ।
न क्षुधा न तृषा निद्रा नैवालस्यं प्रजायते ॥५५॥
transliteration:
yoginīcakrasammānyaḥ[^91] sr̥ṣṭisaṃhārakārakaḥ |
na kṣudhā na tr̥ṣā nidrā naivālasyaṃ prajāyate || 2.55 ||
translation_danish:
[2.55] Han bliver æret af yoginīerne; han skaber og ødelægger verden.
Ikke sult, heller ikke tørst eller søvn, ikke engang dovenskab
forekommer hos ham.
translation_english: [2.55] He is regarded adorable by the Yoginīs and becomes the destroyer of the cycle of creation, He is not afflicted with hunger, thirst, sleep or lassitude.
footnotes_transliteration: [^91]: I nogle varianter af teksten (som anført i Lonāvlā-versionen note 134) finder vi sāmmānyaḥ i stedet for sammānyaḥ, hvorpå oversættelsen bliver den mere śākta (gudinde) orienterede: "Han bliver lig yoginīerne". Yoginīer henviser både til overnaturlige kvindelige væsener og nogle gange til jordiske kvinder, som indgår i en tantrisk rituel sammenhæng. Distinktionen mellem jordiske og guddommelige kvindelige væsener kan være udflydende.

sanskrit:
भवेत्स्वच्छन्ददेहस्तु सर्वोपद्रववर्जितः ।
###### अनेन विधिना सत्यं योगीन्द्रो भूमिमण्डले ॥५६॥
transliteration:
bhavet svacchandadehas tu sarvopadravavarjitaḥ |
anena vidhinā satyaṃ yogīndro bhūmimaṇḍale || 2.56 ||
translation_danish:
[2.56] Hans krop lystrer hans vilje og han bliver fri for alle
sygdomme. Ved hjælp af denne teknik bliver han i sandhed den ypperste
yogi på denne jord.
Dette er Śītalīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.56] The Satwa of his body becomes free from all the disturbances. In truth, he becomes the lord of the Yogīs in this world.

sanskrit:
अथ शीतली
जिह्वया वायुमाकृष्य पूर्ववत्कुम्भसाधनम् ।
शनकैर्घ्राणरन्ध्राभ्यां रेचयेत्पवनं सुधीः ॥५७॥
transliteration:
atha śītalī
jihvayā vāyum ākr̥ṣya pūrvavat kumbhasādhanam |
śanakair ghrāṇarandhrābhyāṃ recayet pavanaṃ sudhīḥ || 2.57 ||
translation_danish:
[2.57] Efter at have trukket vejret via tungen og udført
kumbhakapraksissen som før beskrevet, ånder den vise langsomt ud gennem
begge næsebor.
translation_english: [2.57] As in the above (Sītkári), the tongue to be protruded a little out of the lips, when the air is drawn in. It is kept confined, as before, and then expelled slowly through the nostrils.

sanskrit:
गुल्मप्लीहादिकान्रोगान्ज्वरं पित्तं क्षुधां तृषाम् ।
विषाणि शीतली नाम कुम्भको ऽयं निहन्ति हि ॥५८॥
transliteration:
gulmaplīhādikān rogān jvaraṃ pittaṃ kṣudhāṃ tr̥ṣām |
viṣāṇi śītalī nāma kumbhako 'yaṃ nihanti hi || 2.58 ||
translation_danish:
[2.58] Denne kumbhaka ved navn Śītalī nedkæmper hævede kirtler i maven
og sygdom i milten, feber, galdesyge, sult, tørst, gift og andre
dårligdomme.
Dette er Bhastrikākumbhaka
translation_english: [2.58] This Śītalī Ḳumbhikā cures colic, (enlarged) spleen, fever, disorders of bile, hunger, thirst, and counteracts poisons.

sanskrit:
अथ भस्त्रिका
ऊर्वोरुपरि संस्थाप्य शुभे पादतले उभे ।
पद्मासनं भवेदेतत्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् ॥५९॥
transliteration:
atha bhastrikā
ūrvor upari saṃsthāpya śubhe pādatale ubhe |
padmāsanaṃ bhaved etat sarvapāpapraṇāśanam || 2.59 ||
translation_danish:
[2.59] Begge rene fodsåler placeres oven for lårene. Dette er
Padmāsana. Den fordriver alle dårligdomme.
translation_english: [2.59] The Padma āsana consists in crossing the feet and placing them on both the thighs; it is the destroyer of all sins.

sanskrit:
सम्यक्पद्मासनं बद्ध्वा समग्रीवोदरं सुधीः ।
मुखं संयम्य यत्नेन प्राणं घ्राणेन रेचयेत् ॥६०॥
transliteration:
samyak padmāsanaṃ baddhvā samagrīvodaraṃ sudhīḥ |
mukhaṃ saṃyamya yatnena prāṇaṃ ghrāṇena recayet || 2.60 ||
translation_danish:
[2.60-61] Fast forankret i Padmāsana, holder den vise maven og nakken
ret, lukker munden og ånder kraftigt ud gennem næsen på en sådan måde,
at prāṇaen ledsages af en lyd fra hjertet via halsen og op til kraniet.
Yogien fylder sig da hastigt med luft helt op til hjertets lotus.[^92]
Igen ånder han ud og på samme måde ind, igen og igen.
translation_english: [2.60] Binding the Padma-āsana and keeping the body straight, closing the mouth carefully, let the air be expelled through the nose.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^92]: Hr̥tpadma, 'Hjertets lotus' eller 'Hjertecakraet', er også kendt som anāhata i 6+1-cakra-modellen, som er den mest udbredte cakra-model i Indien og den vestlige verden i dag.

sanskrit:
यथा लगति हृत्कणठे कपालावधि सस्वनम् ।
वेगेन पूरयेच्चापि हृत्पद्मावधि मारुतम् ॥६१॥
transliteration:
yathā lagati hr̥tkaṇṭhe kapālāvadhi sasvanam |
vegena pūrayec cāpi hr̥tpadmāvadhi mārutam || 2.61 ||
translation_danish: NA
translation_english: [2.61] It should be filled up to the lotus of the heart, by drawing it in with force, making noise and touching the throat, the chest and the head.

sanskrit:
पुनर्विरेचयेत्तद्वत्पूरयेच्च पुनः पुनः ।
यथैव लोहकारेण भस्त्रा वेगेन चाल्यते ।
तथैव स्वशरीरस्थं चालयेत्पवनं धिया ॥६२॥
transliteration:
punar virecayet tadvat pūrayec ca punaḥ punaḥ |
yathaiva lohakāreṇa bhastrā vegena cālyate |
tathaiva svaśarīrasthaṃ cālayet pavanaṃ dhiyā || 2.62 ||
translation_danish:
[2.62] Ligesom en blæsebælg bevæges kraftigt af en smed, bør man
bevæge luften kraftigt i sin krop.
translation_english: [2.62] It should he expelled again and filled again and again as before, just as a pair of bellows of the blacksmith is worked.

sanskrit: यदा श्रमो भवेद्देहे तदा सूर्येण पूरयेत् ॥६३॥
transliteration: yadā śramo bhaved dehe tadā sūryeṇa pūrayet || 2.63 ||
translation_danish:
[2.63] Hvis udmattelse opstår i kroppen, bør man indånde gennem
solkanalen.
translation_english: [2.63] In the same way, the air of the body should be moved intelligently, filling it through Sūrya when fatigue is experienced.

sanskrit:
यथोदरं भवेत्पूर्णमनिलेन तथा लघु ।
धारयेन्नासिकां मध्यातर्जनीभ्यां विना दृढम् ।
विधिवत्कुम्भकं कृत्वा रेचयेदिडयानिलम् ॥६४॥
transliteration:
yathodaraṃ bhavet pūrṇam anilena tathā laghu |
dhārayen nāsikāṃ madhyātarjanībhyāṃ vinā dr̥ḍham |
vidhivat kumbhakaṃ kr̥tvā recayed iḍayānilam || 2.64 ||
translation_danish:
[2.64] Maven bør fyldes med luft, hvorved den bliver let. Hold fast om
næsen uden at gøre brug af den midterste finger eller pegefinger. Udfør
kumbhaka som foreskrevet og ånd derpå ud via Iḍā.
translation_english: [2.64] The air should be drawn in through the right nostril by pressing the thumb against the left side of the nose, so as to close the left nostril; and when filled to the full, it should be closed with the fourth finger (the one next to the little finger) and kept confined.

sanskrit: वातपित्तश्लेष्महरं शरीराग्निविवर्धनम् ॥६५॥
transliteration: vātapittaśleṣmaharaṃ śarīrāgnivivardhanam || 2.65 ||
translation_danish: [2.65] Vind, galde og slim fordrives og kroppens forbrænding forøges.
translation_english: [2.65] Having confined it properly, it should be expelled through the Idā (left nostril). This destroys Vāta, pitta (bile) and phlegm and increases the digestive power (the gastric fire).

sanskrit:
कुण्डलीबोधकं क्षिप्रं पवनं सुखदं हितम् ।
ब्रह्मनाडीमुखे संस्थकफाद्यर्गलनाशनम् ॥६६॥
transliteration:
kuṇḍalī bodhakaṃ kṣipraṃ pavanaṃ sukhadaṃ hitam |
brahmanāḍīmukhe saṃsthakaphādyargalanāśanam || 2.66 ||
translation_danish:
[2.66] Kuṇḍalinī[^93] vækkes hurtigt. Den renser, giver fryd og er
gavnlig.
Den fjerner slim og lignende, der blokerer åbningen til
Brahman-kanalen.[^94]
translation_english: [2.66] It quickly awakens the Kuṇḍalinī, purifies the system, gives pleasure, and is beneficial. It destroys phlegm and the impurities accumulated at the entrance of the Brahma Nādī.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^93]: Kuṇḍalī eller Kuṇḍalinī, 'Den sammenrullede [slangekraft]'. En liste af synonymer for Kuṇḍalinī findes i vers 3.104.
[^94]: Brahma-nāḍī, 'Brahman-kanalen', dvs. kanalen, som fører til brahman (det upersonlige absolutte i modsætning til den mandlige skabergud Brahmā). Brahmanāḍī er synonym for Suṣumnā-kanalen.

sanskrit:
सम्यग्गात्रसमुद्भूतग्रन्थित्रयविभेदकम् ।
विशेषेणैव कर्तव्यं भस्त्राख्यं कुम्भकं त्विदम्॥६७॥
transliteration:
samyag gātrasamudbhūtagranthitrayavibhedakam |
viśeṣeṇaiva kartavyaṃ bhastrākhyaṃ kumbhakaṃ tv idam || 2.67 ||
translation_danish:
[2.67] Den splitter fuldstændigt de tre knuder,[^95] der findes i
kroppen. Denne kumbhaka, som kaldes Bhastrā,[^96] bør udføres ofte.
Dette er Bhrāmarīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.67] This Bhastrikā should be performed plentifully, for it breaks the three knots: Brahma granthi (in the chest), Viṣṇu granthi (in the throat), and Rudra granthi (between the eyebrows) of the body.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^95]: Granthi, 'knude'. De tre knuder (2.67, 3.2) udgør 'blokeringer' i Suṣumnā-kanalen, som forhindrer livsenergien (prāṇa) i at flyde frit. De tre knuder er Brahmās knude (4.70), Viṣṇus knude (4.73) og Rudras knude (4.76).
[^96]: Jf. vers 2.8.

sanskrit:
अथ भ्रामरी
वेगाद्घोषं पूरकं भृङ्गनादम्
भृङ्गीनादं रेचकं मन्दमन्दम् ।
योगीन्द्राणामेवमभ्यासयोगात्
चित्ते जाता काचिदानन्दलीला ॥६८॥
transliteration:
atha bhrāmarī
vegād ghoṣaṃ pūrakaṃ bhr̥ṅganādam
bhr̥ṅgīnādaṃ recakaṃ mandamandam |
yogīndrāṇām evam abhyāsayogāt
citte jātā kācid ānandalīlā || 2.68 ||
translation_danish:
[2.68] Ånd kraftigt ind, larmende som lyden af en han-humlebi. Ånd ud,
blidt som lyden af en hun-humlebi. En særlig lyksalighed og ynde opstår
i sindet hos de ypperste yogier som følge af regelmæssig
yogapraksis.[^97]
Dette er Mūrcchākumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.68] By filling the air with force, making noise like Bhringi (wasp), and expelling it slowly, making noise in the same way; this practice causes a sort of ecstacy in the minds of Yogīndras.

sanskrit:
अथ मूर्च्छा
पूरकान्ते गाढतरं बद्ध्वा जालन्धरं शनैः ।
रेचयेन्मूर्च्छनाख्येयं मनोमूर्च्छा सुखप्रदा ॥६९॥
transliteration:
atha mūrcchā
pūrakānte gāḍhataraṃ baddhvā jālandharaṃ śanaiḥ |
recayen mūrcchākhyeyaṃ manomūrcchā sukhapradā || 2.69 ||
translation_danish:
[2.69] Ved afslutningen af indåndingen fastholder man Jālandharabandha
og ånder forsigtigt ud. Denne kumbhaka hedder Mūrchā.[^98] Den stilner
sindet og giver glæde.
Dette er Plāvinīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.69] Closing the passages with Jālandhar Bandha firmly at the end of Pūraka, and expelling the air slowly, is called Mūrchhā, from its causing the mind to swoon and giving comfort.

sanskrit:
अथ प्लाविनी
अन्तःप्रवर्तितोदारमारुतापूरितोदरः ।
पयस्यगाधेऽपि सुखात्प्लवते पद्मपत्रवत् ॥७०॥
transliteration:
atha plāvinī
antaḥ pravartitodāramārutāpūritodaraḥ |
payasyagādhe 'pi sukhāt plavate padmapatravat || 2.70 ||
translation_danish:
[2.70] Fyldt til bristepunktet med luft helt ned i maven, flyder han
med lethed som bladet fra en lotus, selv på bundløst vand.
translation_english: [2.70] When the belly is filled with air and the inside of the body is filled to its utmost with air, the body floats on the deepest water, like the leaf of a lotus.

sanskrit:
प्राणायामस्त्रिधा प्रोक्तो रेचपूरककुम्भकैः ।
सहितः केवलश्चेति कुम्भको द्विविधो मतः ।
यावत्केवलसिद्धिः स्यात्सहितं तावदभ्यसेत् ॥७१॥
transliteration:
prāṇāyāmas tridhā prokto recapūrakakumbhakaiḥ |
sahitaḥ kevalaś ceti kumbhako dvividho mataḥ |
yāvat kevalasiddhiḥ syāt sahitaṃ tāvad abhyaset || 2.71 ||
translation_danish:
[2.71] Prāṇāyāma siges at være trefoldig: udånding, indånding og
kumbhaka, tilbageholdelse af åndedrættet. Ligeledes opfattes kumbhaka
som tofoldig: Sahita- og Kevalakumbhaka.[^99] Indtil Kevalakumbhaka
mestres, bør man praktisere Sahitakumbhaka.
Dette er Sahitakumbhaka:
Udføres udånding og indånding, så er dette Sahitakumbhaka.
Dette er Kevalakumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.71] Considering Pūraka (Filling), Rechaka (expelling) and Kumbhaka (confining), Prāṇāyāma is of three kinds, but considering it accompanied by Pūraka and Rechaka, and without these, it is of two kinds only, i.e., Sahita (with) and Kevala (alone).
footnotes_translation_danish: [^99]: Sahita-kumbhaka, 'Den velgørende kumbhaka', og Kevala-kumbhaka, 'Den eksklusive kumbhaka'.

sanskrit:
अथ सहितः
रेचकः पूरकः कार्यः स वै सहितकुम्भकः ।
अथ केवलः
रेचकं पूरकं मुक्तेवा सुखं यद्वायुधारणम् ।
प्राणायामोऽयमित्युक्तः स वै केवलकुम्भकः ॥७२॥
transliteration:
atha sahitaḥ
recakaḥ pūrakaḥ kāryaḥ sa vai sahitakumbhakaḥ |

atha kevalaḥ
recakaṃ pūrakaṃ muktvā sukhaṃ yad vāyudhāraṇam |
prāṇāyāmo 'yam ity uktaḥ sa vai kevalakumbhakaḥ || 2.72 ||
translation_danish:
[2.72] Undlades udånding og indånding, så opstår glæde ved
fastholdelse af åndedraget. Netop denne prāṇāyāma kaldes Kevalakumbhaka.
translation_english: [2.72] Exercise in Sahita should be continued till success in Kevala is gained. This latter is simply confining the air with ease, without Rechaka and Pūraka.

sanskrit:
कुम्भके केवले सिद्धे रेचपूरकवर्जिते ।
न तस्य दुर्लभं किञ्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥७३॥
transliteration:
kumbhake kevale siddhe recapūrakavarjite |
na tasya durlabhaṃ kiñcit triṣu lokeṣu vidyate || 2.73 ||
translation_danish:
[2.73] Når Kevalakumbhakaen mestres, og ud- og indånding undlades, er
intet i de tre verdener[^100] svært at opnå for yogien.
translation_english: [2.73] In the practice of Kevala Prāṇāyāma when it can be performed successfully without Rechaka and Pūraka, then it is called Kevala Kumbhaka.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^100]: De tre verdener (triloka) er jorden, himmelen og underverden (eller til tider atmosfæren). De tre verdener er udgangspunktet for hindukosmologien, der med tiden voksede til at omfatte 21 verdensniveauer. Samlet set udgør de forskellige verdensniveauer Brahmās æg (brahmāṇdạ).

sanskrit:
शक्तः केवलकुम्भेन यथेष्टं वायुधारणात् ।
राजयोगपदं चापि लभते नात्र संशयः ॥७४॥
transliteration:
śaktaḥ kevalakumbhena yatheṣṭaṃ vāyudhāraṇāt |
rājayogapadaṃ cāpi labhate nātra saṃśayaḥ || 2.74 ||
translation_danish:
[2.74] Ved at fastholde åndedraget som ønsket, sætter Kevalakumbhakaen
ham i stand til at opnå selv rājayoga-stadiet. Derom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [2.74] There is nothing in the three worlds which may be difficult to obtain for him who is able to keep the air confined according to pleasure, by means of Kevala Kumbhaka.

sanskrit: कुम्भकात्कुण्डलीबोधः कुण्डलीबोधतो भवेत् ॥७५॥
transliteration:
kumbhakāt kuṇḍalībodhaḥ kuṇḍalībodhato bhavet |
anargalā suṣumṇā ca haṭhasiddhiś ca jāyate || 2.75 ||
translation_danish:
[2.75] Kumbhakaen vækker Kuṇḍalinī. Ved at vække Kuṇḍalinī bliver
Suṣumṇā fri for blokeringer og fuldkommenhed i haṭhayoga opnås.
translation_english: [2.75] He obtains the position of Rāja Yoga undoubtedly. Kuṇḍalinī [2.75] awakens by Kumbhaka, and by its awakening, Suṣumnā becomes free from impurities.

sanskrit:
अनर्गला सुषुम्ना च हठसिद्धिश्च जायते ।
हठं विना राजयोगो राजयोगं विना हठः ।
न सिध्यति ततो युग्ममानिष्पत्तेः समभ्यसेत् ॥७६॥
transliteration:
haṭhaṃ vinā rājayogo rājayogaṃ vinā haṭhaḥ |
na sidhyati tato yugmam āniṣpatteḥ samabhyaset || 2.76 ||
translation_danish:
[2.76] Haṭhayoga er ikke fuldendt uden rājayoga og rājayoga ikke uden
haṭhayoga. Derfor bør begge praktiseres til fuldkommenhed.
translation_english: [2.76] No success in Rāja Yoga without Haṭha Yoga, and no success in Haṭha Yoga without Rāja Yoga. One should, therefore, practise both of these well, till complete success is gained.

sanskrit:
कुम्भकप्राणरोधान्ते कुर्याच्चित्तं निराश्रयम् ।
एवमभ्यासयोगेन राजयोगपदं व्रजेत् ॥७७॥
transliteration:
kumbhakaprāṇarodhānte kuryāc cittaṃ nirāśrayam |
evam abhyāsayogena rājayogapadaṃ vrajet || 2.77 ||
translation_danish:
[2.77] Sindet bør tømmes, når tilbageholdelsen af prāṇa i kumbhakaen
ophører. Således når man rājayoga-stadiet ved stadig øvelse i yoga.
translation_english: [2.77] On the completion of Kumbhaka, the mind should be given rest. By practising in this way one is raised to the position of (succeeds in getting) Rāja Yoga. [2.77] Indications of success in the practice of Haṭha Yoga.

sanskrit:
वपुःकृशत्वं वदने प्रसन्नता
नादस्फुटत्वं नयने सुनिर्मले ।
अरोगता बिन्दुजयोऽग्निदीपनम् ।
नाडीविशुद्धिर्हठसिद्धिलक्षणम् ॥७८॥
transliteration:
vapuḥ kr̥śatvaṃ vadane prasannatā
nādasphuṭatvaṃ nayane sunirmale |
arogatā bindujayo'gnidīpanaṃ
nāḍīviśuddhir haṭhasiddhilakṣaṇam || 2.78 ||
translation_danish:
[2.78] En smuk og slank figur, et fredfyldt ansigt, tydelig tale, et
klart blik, godt helbred, beherskelse af sæden, øget forbrænding og
fuldstændig renselse af nāḍīerne - dette er tegnene på success i
haṭhayoga.
Således slutter anden belæring i Haṭhapradīpikā ved navn 'Instruktion i
prāṇāyāma'[^101] udarbejdet af Svātmarāma Yogendra fra Sahajānanda
Cintāmani-successionen.

TREDJE BELÆRING:
YOGISKE TEKNIKKER (MUDRĀ)
Tredje belæring
translation_english: [2.78] When the body becomes lean, the face glows with delight, Anāhatanāda manifests, and eyes are clear, body is healthy, bindu under control, and appetite increases, then one should know that the Nādīs are purified and success in Haṭha Yoga is approaching.

sanskrit:
इति सहजानन्द​सन्तानचिन्तामणिस्वात्माराम​योगीन्द्र​विरचितायां
हठप्रदीपिकायां प्राणायाम​विधिकथनं नाम​ द्वितीयोपदेशः ॥
तृतीयोपदेशः
सशैलवनधात्रीणां यथाधारोऽहिनायकः ।
सर्वेषां योगतन्त्राणां तथाधारो हि कुण्डली ॥१॥
transliteration:
iti sahajānandasantānacintāmaṇisvātmārāmayogīndraviracitāyāṃ
haṭhapradīpikāyāṃ [prāṇāyāmavidhikathanaṃ nāma] dvitīyopadeśaḥ ||
tr̥tīyopadeśaḥ
saśailavanadhātrīṇāṃ yathādhāro'hināyakaḥ |
sarveṣāṃ yogatantrāṇāṃ tathādhāro hi kuṇḍalī || 3.1 ||
translation_danish:
[3.1] Ligesom Slangernes Herre opretholder Moder Jord med hendes
bjerge og skove, således opretholder slangekraften Kuṇḍalinī alle
tantriske doktriner om yoga.
translation_english: [3.1] As the chief of the snakes is the support of the earth with all the mountains and forests on it, so all the Tantras (Yoga practices) rest on the Kuṇḍalinī. (The Vertebral column.)

sanskrit:
सुप्ता गुरुप्रसादेन यदा जागर्ति कुण्डली ।
तदा सर्वाणि पद्मानि भिद्यन्ते ग्रन्थयोऽपि च​ ॥२॥
transliteration:
suptā guruprasādena yadā jāgarti kuṇḍalī |
tadā sarvāṇi padmāni bhidyante granthayo'pi ca || 3.2 ||
translation_danish:
[3.2] Når den sovende Kuṇḍalinī vågner brat i kraft af guruens nåde,
da splittes alle lotusser[^102] og granthier[^103] ligeså.
translation_english: [3.2] When the sleeping Kuṇḍalinī awakens by favour of a guru, then all the lotuses (in the six chakras or centres) and all the knots are pierced through.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^102]: Her er lotus (padma) synonym med cakra.
[^103]: Granthi, 'knude'.

sanskrit:
प्राणस्य शून्यपदवी तदा राजपथायते ।
तदा चित्तं निरालम्बं तदा कालस्य वञ्चनम् ॥३॥
transliteration:
prāṇasya śūnyapadavī tadā rājapathāyate |
tadā cittaṃ nirālambaṃ tadā kālasya vañcanam || 3.3 ||
translation_danish:
[3.3] Den åbne kongevej[^104] er prāṇaens uhindrede vej. Sindet er
selvberoende. Døden snydes.
translation_english: [3.3] sa-śaila-vana-dhātrīṇāṃ yathādhāro|ahi-nāyakaḥ | [3.3] Suṣumnā (Sūnya Padavī) becomes a main road for the passage of Prāṇa, and the mind then becomes free from all connections (with its objects of enjoyments) and Death is then evaded.

sanskrit:
सुषुम्णा शून्यपदवी ब्रह्मरन्ध्रं महापथः ।
श्मशानं शाम्भवी मध्यमार्गश्चेत्येकवाचका: ॥४॥
transliteration:
suṣumṇā śūnyapadavī brahmarandhraṃ mahāpathaḥ |
śmaśānaṃ śāmbhavī madhyamārgaś cety ekavācakāḥ || 3.4 ||
translation_danish:
[3.4] Śūnyapadavī, Brahmarandhra, Mahāpatha, Śmaśāna, Śāmbhavī og
Madhyamārga er alle synonymer for Suṣumṇā.[^105]
translation_english: [3.4] Suṣumnā, Sunya Padavī, Brahma Randhra, Mahā Patha, Śmaśāna, Śambhavī, Madhya Mārga, are names of one and the same thing.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^105]: Śūnyapadavī, 'tomhedens sti', Brahmarandhra, 'Brahmans sprække', Mahāpatha, 'Hovedvejen', Śmaśāna, 'Ligbrændingspladsen', Śāmbhavī, 'Śivas hustru, Velynderen', Madhyamārga, 'Den midterste vej, Suṣumṇā, 'Den elskværdige'.

sanskrit:
तस्मात्सर्वप्रयत्नेन प्रबोधयितुमीश्वरीम् ।
ब्रह्मद्वारमुखे सुप्तां मुद्राभ्यासं समाचरेत् ॥५॥
transliteration:
tasmāt sarvaprayatnena prabodhayitum īśvarīm |
brahmadvāramukhe suptāṃ mudrābhyāsaṃ samācaret || 3.5 ||
translation_danish:
[3.5] Derfor bør man hengive sig til mudrā-praksis og af al kraft
vække gudinden, der sover ved indgangen til Brahmans dør.[^106]
translation_english: [3.5] In order, therefore, to awaken this goddess, who is sleeping at the entrance of Brahma Dwāra (the great door), mudrās should be practised well.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^106]: Brahmans dør refererer her til indgangen til Suṣumnā-kanalen.

sanskrit:
महामुद्रा महाबन्धो महावेधश्च खेचरी ।
उड्डीयानं मूलबन्धस्ततो जालन्धराभिधः ॥
करणी विपरीताख्या वज्रोली शक्तिचालनम् ॥६॥
transliteration:
mahāmudrā mahābandho mahāvedhaś ca khecarī |
uḍḍīyānaṃ mūlabandhas tato jālandharābhidhaḥ ||
karaṇī viparītākhyā vajrolī śakticālanam || 3.6 ||
translation_danish:
[3.6] Mahāmudrā, Mahābandha, Mahāvedha og Khecarī, Uḍḍīyana,
Mūlabandha og dertil Jālandhara, Viparītakaraṇī, Vajrolī og
Śakticālana;[^107]
translation_english: [3.6] Mahā Mudrā, Mahā Bandha, Mahā Vedha, Khecharī, Uḍḍiyāna Bandha, Mūla Bandha, Jālandhara Bandha.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^107]: Mahāmudrā, 'Den store mudrā', Mahābandha, 'Den store lås', Mahāvedha, 'Den store gennemtrængning', og Khecarī, 'Bevægende sig i rummet', Uḍḍīyana, 'Den opadflyvende', Mūlabandha, 'Rodlåsen', og dertil Jālandhara, 'Vandbæreren', Viparītakaraṇī, 'Den omvendte teknik', Vajrolī, 'Vajrolī-mudrāen' (formentlig 'tordenkile' (vajra) og 'løg' (ūlī) med reference til mandens ædlere dele) og Śakticālana, 'Bevægeren af śakti'.

sanskrit:
इदं हि मुद्रादशकं जरामरणनाशनम् ।
आदिनाथोदितं दिव्यमष्टैश्वर्यप्रदायकम् ।
वल्लभं सर्वसिद्धानां दुर्लभं मरुतामपि ॥ ७ ॥
transliteration:
idaṃ hi mudrādaśakaṃ jarāmaraṇanāśanam |
ādināthoditaṃ divyam aṣṭaiśvaryapradāyakam |
vallabhaṃ sarvasiddhānāṃ durlabhaṃ marutām api || 3.7 ||
translation_danish:
[3.7] Dette er de ti mudrāer, som tilintetgør alderdom og død. Disse
himmelske mudrāer, som blev udlagt af den oprindelige Herre Śiva,
medfører de otte overnaturlige kræfter. Mudrāerne hyldes af alle
fuldkomne yogier og er vanskelige at udføre selv for guderne.[^108]
translation_english: [3.7] Viparīta Karaṇī, Vajroli, and Śakti Chālana. These are the ten Mudrās which annihilate old age and death.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^108]: 'Guderne' refererer her til maruterne, som er en gruppe af vediske stormguder.

sanskrit:
गोपनीयं प्रयत्नेन यथा रत्नकरण्डकम् ।
कस्यचिन्नैव वक्तव्यं कुलस्त्रीसुरतं यथा ॥८॥
transliteration:
gopanīyaṃ prayatnena yathā ratnakaraṇḍakam |
kasyacin naiva vaktavyaṃ kulastrīsurataṃ yathā || 3.8 ||
translation_danish:
[3.8] Man bør bestræbe sig på at holde dem hemmelige, som var de en
kurv med juveler. De bør ikke omtales for nogen, som forlystede man sig
med en kvinde af god familie.
Dette er Mahāmudrā:
translation_english: [3.8] They have been explained by ādi Nātha (Śiva) and give eight kinds of divine wealth. They are loved by all the Siddhas and are hard to attain even by the Marutas. [1]

sanskrit:
अथ महामुद्रा
पादमूलेन वामेन योनिं सम्पीड्य दक्षिणम् ।
प्रसारितं पदं कृत्वा कराभ्यां धारयेद्दृढम् ॥९॥
transliteration:
atha mahāmudrā
pādamūlena vāmena yoniṃ sampīḍya dakṣiṇam |
prasāritaṃ padaṃ kr̥tvā karābhyāṃ dhārayed dr̥ḍham || 3.9 ||
translation_danish:
[3.9] Pres venstre hæl mod stedet for skeden.[^109] Stræk højre fod
frem og hold den fast med begge hænder;
translation_english: [3.9] These Mudrās should be kept secret by every means, as one keeps one's box of jewellery, and should, on no account be told to any one, just as husband and wife keep their dealings secret.

sanskrit:
कण्ठे बन्धं समारोप्य धारयेद्वायुमूर्ध्वतः ।
यथा दण्डहतः सर्पो दण्डाकारः प्रजायते ॥
ऋज्वीभूता तथा शक्तिः कुण्डली सहसा भवेत् ॥१०॥
transliteration:
kaṇṭhe bandhaṃ samāropya dhārayed vāyum ūrdhvataḥ |
yathā daṇḍahataḥ sarpo daṇḍākāraḥ prajāyate ||
r̥jvībhūtā tathā śaktiḥ kuṇḍalī sahasā bhavet || 3.10 ||
translation_danish:
[3.10] luk af for struben med en bandha[^110] og pres luften opad.
Ligesom en slange slået med en stok antager form af en stok, således
bliver den sammenrullede śakti straks udstrakt.
translation_english: [3.10] Pressing the Yoni (perineum) with the heel of the left foot, and stretching forth the right foot, its toe should be grasped by the thumb and first finger.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^110]: Her refereres der til Jālandhara-bandha, 'Vandbærerlåsen', eller Kaṇṭha-bandha, 'Strubelåsen'.

sanskrit: तदा सा मरणावस्था जायते द्विपुटाश्रया ॥११॥
transliteration: tadā sā maraṇāvasthā jāyate dvipuṭāśrayā || 3.11 ||
translation_danish:
[3.11] Śakti, som er forbundet med de to kanaler, bliver stiv som et
lig.[^111]
translation_english: [3.11] ṝjvībhūtā tathā śaktiḥ kuṇḍalī sahasā bhavet |
footnotes_translation_danish: [^111]: Śakti indgår i maraṇāvasthā, dvs. den antager en dødslignende tilstand.

sanskrit:
ततः शनैः शनैरेव रेचयेन्न तु वेगतः।
इयं खलु महामुद्रा महासिद्धैः प्रदर्शिता॥१२॥
transliteration:
tataḥ śanaiḥ śanair eva recayen na tu vegataḥ |
iyaṃ khalu mahāmudrā mahāsiddhaiḥ pradarśitā || 3.12 ||
translation_danish:
[3.12] Ånd derefter forsigtigt ud - aldrig pludseligt.
Dette er sandelig Mahāmudrā, som blev udlagt af de store siddhaer.
translation_english: [3.12] By stopping the throat (by Jālandhara Bandha) the air is drawn in from the outside and carried down. Just as a snake struck with a stick becomes straight like a stick, in the same way, śakti (suṣumnā) becomes straight at once. Then the Kuṇḍalinī, becoming as it were dead, and, leaving both the Idā and the Pingalā, enters the suṣumnā (the middle passage).

sanskrit:
महाक्लेशादयो दोषाः क्षीयन्ते मरणादयः।
महामुद्रां च तेनैव वदन्ति विबुधोत्तमाः॥१३॥
transliteration:
mahākleśādayo doṣāḥ kṣīyante maraṇādayaḥ |
mahāmudrāṃ ca tenaiva vadanti vibudhottamāḥ || 3.13 ||
translation_danish:
[3.13] Store lidelser, dårligdomme, død og så videre destrueres.
Derfor kalder de ypperste vismænd denne mudrā for Mahāmudrā.[^112]
translation_english: [3.13] It should be expelled then, slowly only and not violently. For this very reason, the best of the wise men call it the Mahā Mudrā. This Mahā Mudrā has been propounded by great masters.

sanskrit:
चन्द्राङ्गे तु समभ्यस्य सूर्याङ्गे पुनरभ्यसेत् ।
यावत्तुल्या भवेत्संख्या ततो मुद्रां विसर्जयेत् ॥१४॥
transliteration:
candrāṅge tu samabhyasya sūryāṅge punar abhyaset |
yāvat tulyā bhavet saṃkhyā tato mudrāṃ visarjayet || 3.14 ||
translation_danish:
[3.14] Efter at have øvet med månesiden, øv da med solsiden. Slip
mudrāen når antallet er lige.
translation_english: [3.14] Great evils and pains, like death, are destroyed by it, and for this reason wise men call it the Mahā Mudrā.

sanskrit:
न हि पथ्यमपथ्यं वा रसाः सर्वेऽपि नीरसाः।
अपि भुक्तं विषं घोरं पीयूषमिव जीर्यति॥१५॥
transliteration:
na hi pathyam apathyaṃ vā rasāḥ sarve'pi nīrasāḥ |
api bhuktaṃ viṣaṃ ghoraṃ pīyūṣam iva jīryati || 3.15 ||
translation_danish:
[3.15] Intet er foreskrevet eller forbudt. Alt vil blive fordøjet som
var det råmælk, smagfuldt eller smagløst, sågar den rene gift.
translation_english: [3.15] Having practised with the left nostril, it should be practised with the right one; and, when the number on both sides becomes equal, then the mudrā should be discontinued.

sanskrit:
क्षयकुष्ठागुदावर्तगुल्माजीर्णपुरोगमाः।
तस्य दोषाः क्षयं यान्ति महामुद्रां तु योऽभ्यसेत्॥१६॥
transliteration:
kṣayakuṣṭhāgudāvartagulmājīrṇapurogamāḥ |
tasya doṣāḥ kṣayaṃ yānti mahāmudrāṃ tu yo 'bhyaset || 3.16 ||
translation_danish:
[3.16] Tuberkulose, spedalskhed, tarmslyng, forstørret milt,
forstoppelse, dårlig fordøjelse og så videre - alle disse dårligdomme
forsvinder for den, der praktiserer Mahāmudrā.
translation_english: [3.16] There is nothing wholesome or injurious; for the practice of this mudrā destroys the injurious effects of all the rasas (chemicals). Even the deadliest of poisons, if taken, acts like nectar.

sanskrit:
कथितेयं महामुद्रा महासिद्धिकरी नृणाम्।
गोपनीया प्रयत्नेन न देया यस्य कस्यचित्॥१७॥
transliteration:
kathiteyaṃ mahāmudrā mahāsiddhikarī nr̥ṇām |
gopanīyā prayatnena na deyā yasya kasyacit || 3.17 ||
translation_danish:
[3.17] Den udlagte Mahāmudrā, som giver mægtige magiske kræfter til
mennesker, bør hemmeligholdes med stor omhu og ikke formidles til nogen
anden.
Dette er Mahābandha:
translation_english: [3.17] Consumption, leprosy, prolapsus anii, colic, and the diseases due to indigestion,—all these irregularities are removed by the practice of this Mahā Mudrā.

sanskrit:
अथ महाबन्धः
पार्ष्णिं वामस्य पादस्य योनिस्थाने नियोजयेत् ।
वामोरूपरि संस्थाप्य दक्षिणं चरणं तथा ॥
पूरयित्वा ततो वायुं हृदये चिबुकं दृढम् ।
निष्पीड्य योनिमाकुञ्च्य मनो मध्ये नियोजयेत् ॥१८-१९॥
transliteration:
atha mahābandhaḥ
pārṣṇiṃ vāmasya pādasya yonisthāne niyojayet |
vāmorūpari saṃsthāpya dakṣiṇaṃ caraṇaṃ tathā || 3.18 ||
translation_danish:
[3.18-19] Venstre hæl placeres ved stedet for skeden og højre fod
placeres på venstre lår. Træk vejret ind og pres hagen hårdt mod
hjertet. Træk stedet for skeden sammen og fæstn sindet i det
midterste.[^113]
translation_english: [3.18] This Mahā Mudrā has been described as the giver of great success (Siddhi) to men. It should be kept secret by every effort, and not revealed to any and everyone. [3.19] Press the left heel to the perineum and place the right foot on the left thigh.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^113]: Stedet for skeden (yoni) henviser til rodcakraet (mūladhāra), ligesom 'det midterste' henviser til Suṣumnā-kanalen.

sanskrit:
धारयित्वा यथाशक्ति रेचयेदनिलं शनैः।
सव्याङ्गे तु समभ्यस्य दक्षाङ्गे पुनरभ्यसेत्॥२०॥
transliteration:
dhārayitvā yathāśakti recayed anilaṃ śanaiḥ |
savyāṅge tu samabhyasya dakṣāṅge punar abhyaset || 3.20 ||
translation_danish:
[3.20] Hold vejret så længe som muligt, ånd da forsigtigt ud. Efter at
have øvet med venstre side, øv da med højre side.
translation_english: [3.20] Fill in the air, keeping the chin firm against the chest, and, having pressed the air, the mind should he fixed on the middle of the eyebrows or in the suṣumnā (the spine).

sanskrit:
मतमत्र तु केषाञ्चित्कण्ठबन्धं विवर्जयेत् ।
राजदन्तस्थजिह्वाया बन्धः शस्तो भवेदिति ॥२१॥
transliteration:
matam atra tu keṣāñcit kaṇṭhabandhaṃ vivarjayet |
rājadantasthajihvāyā bandhaḥ śasto bhaved iti || 3.21 ||
translation_danish:
[3.21] En anden opfattelse i denne sag er: Yogien bør undgå
Kaṇṭhabandha.[^114] Bandhaen bør derimod bestå i en placering af tungen
på drøblen.[^115]
translation_english: [3.21] Having kept it confined so long as possible, it should be expelled slowly. Having practised on the left side, it should be practised on the right side.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^114]: Kaṇṭha-bandha, 'Strubelåsen' (3.10).
[^115]: Rājadanta, 'Den royale tand', kan både referere til fortænderne og til drøblen (uvula). Mest sandsynligt er her tale om den yogiske teknik Khecarīmudrā (jf. 3.31-54), hvor tungen placeres på drøblen og lukker for svælget. Drøblen omtales også som Talucakra af den senere Nāth Yogi tradition.

sanskrit:
अयं तु सर्वनाडीनामूर्ध्वगतिनिरोधकः ।
अयं खलु महाबन्धो महासिद्धिप्रदायकः ॥२२॥
transliteration:
ayaṃ tu sarvanāḍīnām ūrdhvagatinirodhakaḥ |
ayaṃ khalu mahābandho mahāsiddhipradāyakaḥ || 3.22 ||
translation_danish:
[3.22] Dette stopper den opadgående bevægelse i alle kanaler.
Mahābandhaen giver sandeligt mægtige siddhier.
translation_english: [3.22] Some are of opinion that the closing of throat is not necessary here, for keeping the tongue pressed against the roots of the upper teeth makes a good bandha (stop).

sanskrit:
कालपाशमहाबन्धविमोचनविचक्षणः ।
त्रिवेणीसङ्गमं धत्ते केदारं प्रापयेन्मनः ॥२३॥
transliteration:
kālapāśamahābandhavimocanavicakṣaṇaḥ |
triveṇīsaṅgamaṃ dhatte kedāraṃ prāpayen manaḥ || 3.23 ||
translation_danish:
[3.23] Mahābandha løsner på fremragende vis dødens snare og forårsager
flodernes sammenløb[^116] og sindets opnåelse af Kedāra.[^117]
Dette er Mahāvedha:
translation_english: [3.23] This stops the upward motion of all the Nādīs. Verily this Mahā Bandha is the giver of great Siddhis.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^116]: De tre floders sammenløb (triveṇī) refererer til de hellige indiske floders sammenløb (prayāga), som i dag geografisk finder sted i Allahabad. Her mødes floderne Ganges, Yamunā og den mytologiske Sarasvatī. I verset anvendes udtrykket flodernes sammenløb (triveṇī) som esoterisk metafor for de indre floder eller kanaler Iḍā, Pingalā og Suṣumnā.
[^117]: Kedāra, som er navnet på en hellig sø i Himālaya-regionen, anvendes her som metafor for en indre sø af guddommelig nektar (amr̥takuṇḍa) placeret mellem øjenbrynene. Her holder guden Śiva til (jf. Śivas epitet Kedāranāth, som stadig anvendes i Himālaya-regionen i dag).

sanskrit:
अथ महावेधः
रूपलावण्यसम्पन्ना यथा स्त्री पुरुषं विना ।
महामुद्रामहाबन्धौ निष्फलौ वेधवर्जितौ ॥२४॥
transliteration:
atha mahāvedhaḥ
rūpalāvaṇyasampannā yathā strī puruṣaṃ vinā |
mahāmudrāmahābandhau niṣphalau vedhavarjitau || 3.24 ||
translation_danish:
[3.24] Mahāmudrā og Mahābandha er frugtesløse uden Mahāvedha,[^118]
ligesom en smuk og attraktiv kvinde er frugtesløs uden en mand.
translation_english: [3.24] This Mahā Bandha is the most skilful means for cutting away the snares of death. It brings about the conjunction of the Trivenī (Idā, Pingalā and Suṣumnā) and carries the mind to Kedār (the space between the eyebrows, which is the seat of Śiva).

sanskrit:
महाबन्धस्थितो योगी कृत्वा पूरकमेकधीः ।
वायूनां गतिमावृत्य निभृतं कण्ठमुद्रया ॥२५॥
transliteration:
mahābandhasthito yogī kr̥tvā pūrakam ekadhīḥ |
vāyūnāṃ gatim āvr̥tya nibhr̥taṃ kaṇṭhamudrayā || 3.25 ||
translation_danish:
[3.25] Idet yogien sidder i Mahābandha med fyldte lunger, opnår han et
fokuseret sind. Han forsegler med kaṇṭha-mudrā efter at have stoppet
luftens bevægelse.
translation_english: [3.25] As beauty and loveliness, do not avail a woman without husband, so the Mahā Mudrā and the Mahā-Bandha are useless without the Mahā Vedha.

sanskrit:
समहस्तयुगो भूमौ स्फिचौ संताडयेच्छनैः ।
पुटद्वयमतिक्रम्य वायुः स्फुरति मध्यगः ॥२६॥
transliteration:
samahastayugo bhūmau sphicau saṃtāḍayec chanaiḥ |
puṭadvayam atikramya vāyuḥ sphurati madhyagaḥ || 3.26 ||
translation_danish:
[3.26] Han bør placere begge hænder på jorden ved ballerne og
forsigtigt løfte sig. Luften forlader begge kanaler og går sitrende i
den midterste.[^119]
translation_english: [3.26] Sitting with Mahā Bandha, the Yogī should fill in the air and keep his mind collected. The movements of the Vāyus (Prāṇa and Apāna) should be stopped by closing the throat.)
footnotes_translation_danish: [^119]: Begge kanaler refererer til Iḍā og Piṅgalā og den midterste kanal til Suṣumnā.

sanskrit:
सोमसूर्याग्निसंबन्धो जायते चामृताय वै ।
मृतावस्था समुत्पन्ना ततो वायुं विरेचयेत् ॥२७॥
transliteration:
somasūryāgnisambandho jāyate cāmr̥tāya vai |
mr̥tāvasthā samutpannā tato vāyuṃ virecayet || 3.27 ||
translation_danish:
[3.27] Måne, sol og ild forenes og fører direkte til udødelighed. En
dødslignende tilstand opstår, hvorpå yogien bør ånde ud.[^120]
translation_english: [3.27] Resting both the hands equally on the ground, he should raise himself a little and strike his buttocks against the ground gently. The air, leaving both the passages (Idā and Pingalā), starts into the middle one.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^120]: Måne (soma), sol og ild referer til henholdsvis Iḍā, Piṅgalā og Suṣumnā.

sanskrit:
महावेधोऽयमभ्यासान्महासिद्धिप्रदायकः ।
वलीपलितवेपघ्नः सेव्यते साधकोत्तमैः ॥२८॥
transliteration:
mahāvedho'yam abhyāsān mahāsiddhipradāyakaḥ |
valīpalitavepaghnaḥ sevyate sādhakottamaiḥ || 3.28 ||
translation_danish:
[3.28] Ved regelmæssig praksis giver denne Mahāvedha mægtige siddhier.
Den tilintetgør rynker, gråt hår og rysten. Den udøves af de ypperste
yogier.
translation_english: [3.28] The union of the Idā and the Pingalā is effected, in order to bring about immortality. When the air becomes as it were dead (by leaving its course through the Idā and the Pingalā) (i.e., when it has been kept confined), then it should be expelled.

sanskrit:
एतत्त्रयं महागुह्यं ज​रामृत्युविनाशनम् ।
वह्रिवृद्धिकारं चैव ह्यणिमादिगुणप्रदम् ॥२९॥
transliteration:
etat trayaṃ mahāguhyaṃ jarāmr̥tyuvināśanam |
vahnivr̥ddhikaraṃ caiva hy aṇimādiguṇapradam || 3.29 ||
translation_danish:
[3.29] Trefoldigheden er en stor hemmelighed, som tilintetgør alderdom
og død. Den øger fordøjelsens ild og giver kvaliteter, såsom
aṇiman[^121].
translation_english: [3.29] The practice of this Mahā Vedha, the giver of great Siddhis, destroys old age, grey hair, and shaking of the body, and therefore it is practised by the best masters.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^121]: Aṇiman, "evnen til at blive forsvindende lille".

sanskrit:
अष्टधा क्रियते चैव यामे यामे दिने दिने ।
पुण्यसंभारसंधायि पापौघभिदुरं सदा ।
सम्यक्शिक्षावतामेवं स्वल्पं प्रथमसाधनम् ॥३०॥
transliteration:
aṣṭadhā kriyate caiva yāme yāme dine dine |
puṇyasaṃbhārasandhāya pāpaughabhiduraṃ sadā |
samyakśikṣāvatām evaṃ svalpaṃ prathamasādhanam || 3.30 ||
translation_danish:
[3.30] Den bør udføres hver tredje time otte gange om dagen, dag efter
dag. Det er god praksis at starte i det små. Trefoldigheden giver stor
religiøs merit og destruerer altid et væld af onder.
Dette er Khecarīmudrā:
translation_english: [3.30] These THREE are the great secrets. They are the destroyers of old age and death, increase the appetite, confer the accomplishments of Anima, etc.

sanskrit:
अथ खेचरी
कपालकुहरे जिह्वा प्रविष्टा विपरीतगा ।
भ्रुवोरन्तर्गता दृष्टिर्मुद्रा भवति खेचरी ॥३१॥
transliteration:
atha khecarī
kapālakuhare jihvā praviṣṭā viparītagā |
bhruvor antargatā dr̥ṣṭir mudrā bhavati khecarī || 3.31 ||
translation_danish:
[3.31] Med blikket fikseret mellem øjenbrynene og tungen bøjet helt
tilbage ind i kraniets hulrum; dette er Khecarī-mudrā.[^122]
translation_english: [3.31] They should, be practised in 8 ways, daily and hourly. They increase collection of good actions and lessen the evil ones. People, instructed well, should begin their practice, little by little, first.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^122]: Khecarī, "En, der bevæger sig i rummet". Khecarī er femininum og kan betegne kvindelige praktiserende eller overnaturlige væsener (yoginīer). Khecara er den mandlige pendant.

sanskrit:
छेदनचालनदोहैः कलां क्रमेण वर्धयेत्तावत् ।
सा यावद्भ्रूमध्यं स्पृशति तदा खेचरी सिद्धिः ॥३२॥
transliteration:
chedanacālanadohaiḥ kalāṃ krameṇa vardhayet tāvat |
sā yāvad bhrūmadhyaṃ spr̥śati tadā khecarī siddhiḥ || 3.32 ||
translation_danish:
[3.32] Ved at skære, bevæge og hive, bør yogien gradvist forlænge
tungen indtil
den berører midten af øjenbrynene. Herved er Khecarī-mudrā fuldkommen
translation_english: [3.32] The Khechari Mudrā is accomplished by thrusting the tongue into the gullet, by turning it over itself, and keeping the eyesight in the middle of the eyebrows.

sanskrit:
स्नुहीपत्रनिभं शस्त्रं सुतीक्ष्णं स्निग्धनिर्मलम् ।
समादाय ततस्तेन रोममात्रं समुच्छिनेत् ॥३३॥
transliteration:
snuhīpatranibhaṃ śastraṃ sutīkṣṇaṃ snigdhanirmalam |
samādāya tatas tena romamātraṃ samucchinet || 3.33 ||
translation_danish:
[3.33] Han bør finde en ren, glat og meget skarp kniv i lighed med et
blad fra en vortemælksplante[^123] og lave et hårsbredt snit i
tungebåndet.
translation_english: [3.33] To accomplish this, the tongue is lengthened by cutting the frænum linguæ, moving, and pulling it. When it can touch the space between the eyebrows, then Khechari can be accomplished.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^123]: Snuhī er en plante af vortemælk-slægten (Euphorbieae) fra familien Euphorbiaceae.

sanskrit:
ततः सैन्धवपथ्याभ्यां चूर्णिताभ्यां प्रघर्षयेत् ।
पुनः सप्तदिने प्राप्ते रोममात्रं समुच्छिनेत् ॥३४॥
transliteration:
tataḥ saindhavapathyābhyāṃ cūrṇitābhyāṃ pragharṣayet |
punaḥ saptadine prāpte romamātraṃ samucchinet || 3.34 ||
translation_danish:
[3.34] Han bør da indsmøre tungebåndet i knust bjergsalt og kvast
myrobalan[^124] og lave et hårsbredt snit mere efter syv dage.
translation_english: [3.34] Taking a sharp, smooth, and clean instrument, of the shape of a cactus leaf, the frænum of the tongue should be cut a little (as much as a hair's thickness), at a time.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^124]: Myrobalan er en tørret frugt fra indiske træer af slægten Terminalia, som pga. et stort indhold af garvestof bruges som garvemiddel.

sanskrit:
एवं क्रमेण षण्मासं नित्ययुक्तः समाचरेत् ।
षण्मासाद्रसनामूलशिराबन्धः प्रणश्यति ॥३५॥
transliteration:
evaṃ krameṇa ṣaṇmāsaṃ nityayuktaḥ samācaret |
ṣaṇmāsād rasanāmūlaśirābandhaḥ praṇaśyati || 3.35 ||
translation_danish:
[3.35] Den dedikerede yogi bør gøre sådan gradvist og regelmæssigt i
et halvt år. Efter et halvt år er tungebåndet ved tungens rod
forsvundet.
translation_english: [3.35] Then rock salt and yellow myrobalan (both powdered) should be rubbed in. On the 7th day, it should again be cut a hair's breadth.

sanskrit:
कलां पराङ्मुखीं कृत्वा त्रिपथे परियोजयेत् ।
सा भबेत्खेचरी मुद्रा व्योमचक्रं तदुच्यते ॥३६॥
transliteration:
kalāṃ parāṅmukhīṃ kr̥tvā tripathe pariyojayet |
sā bhavet khecarī mudrā vyomacakraṃ tad ucyate || 3.36 ||
translation_danish:
[3.36] Yogien bør bøje tungen bagover og placere den derinde, hvor de
tre veje[^125] mødes, hvilket benævnes Vyoma-cakraet.[^126] Dette er
Khecarī-mudrā.
translation_english: [3.36] One should go on doing thus, regularly for six months. At the end of six months, the frænum of the tongue will be completely cut.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^125]: Iḍā-, Piṅgalā- og Suṣumnā.
[^126]: Stedet, hvor de tre veje mødes, kaldes Vyoma-cakraet, som er afledt af ordet vyoman, "rum".

sanskrit:
रसनामूर्ध्वगां कृत्वा क्षणार्धमपि तिष्ठति ।
विषैर्विमुच्यते योगी व्याधिमृत्युजरादिभिः ॥३७॥
transliteration:
rasanām ūrdhvagāṃ kr̥tvā kṣaṇārdham api tiṣṭhati |
viṣair vimucyate yogī vyādhimr̥tyujarādibhiḥ || 3.37 ||
translation_danish:
[3.37] En yogi, som fører tungen opad og holder den dér - selv et kort
øjeblik - undslipper gift, sygdom, død, alderdom og så videre.
translation_english: [3.37] Turning the tongue upwards, it is fixed on the three ways (œsophagus, windpipe and palate.) Thus it makes the Khechari Mudrā, and is called the Vyoma Chakra.

sanskrit:
न रोगो मरणं तन्द्रा न निद्रा न क्षुधा तृषा ।
न च मूर्छा भवेत्तस्य यो मुद्रां वेत्ति खेचरीम् ॥३८॥
transliteration:
na rogo maraṇaṃ tandrā na nidrā na kṣudhā tr̥ṣā |
na ca mūrchā bhavet tasya yo mudrāṃ vetti khecarīm || 3.38 ||
translation_danish:
[3.38] Han, som kender Khecarī-mudrā, rammes hverken af sygdom, død,
udmattelse, træthed, sult eller tørst, ej heller af sløvsind.
translation_english: [3.38] The Yogī who sits for a minute turning his tongue upwards, is saved from poisons, diseases, death, old age, etc.

sanskrit:
पीड्यते न स रोगेण लिप्यते न च कर्मणा ।
बाध्यते न स कालेन यो मुद्रां वेत्ति खेचरीम् ॥३९॥
transliteration:
pīḍyate na sa rogeṇa lipyate na ca karmaṇā |
bādhyate na sa kālena yo mudrāṃ vetti khecarīm || 3.39 ||
translation_danish:
[3.39] Yogien, som kender Khecarī-mudrā, er ikke plaget af sygdomme,
ej heller besmittet med karma. Han er ikke plaget af tiden og døden.
translation_english: [3.39] He who knows the Khechari Mudrā is not afflicted with disease, death, sloth, sleep, hunger, thirst, and swooning.

sanskrit:
चित्तं चरति खे यस्माज्जिह्वा चरति खे गता ।
तेनैषा खेचरी नाम मुद्रा सिद्धैर्निरुपिता ॥४०॥
transliteration:
cittaṃ carati khe yasmāj jihvā carati khe gatā |
tenaiṣā khecarī nāma mudrā siddhair nirūpitā || 3.40 ||
translation_danish:
[3.40] Idet tungen går ind i hulrummet, vandrer sindet i rummet.
Derfor ynder de fuldkomne yogier at kalde denne mudrā for Khecarī.[^127]
translation_english: [3.40] He who knows the Khechari Mudrā, is not troubled by diseases, is not stained with karmas, and is not snared by time.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^127]: Khecarī, "En, der bevæger sig i rummet". Khecarī er femininum og kan betegne kvindelige praktiserende eller overnaturlige væsener (yoginīer). Khecara er den mandlige pendant.

sanskrit:
खेचर्या मुद्रितं येन विवरं लम्बिकोर्ध्वतः ।
न तस्य क्षरते बिन्दुः कामिन्या श्लेषितस्य च ॥४१॥
transliteration:
khecaryā mudritaṃ yena vivaraṃ lambikordhvataḥ |
na tasya kṣarate binduḥ kāminyā śleṣitasya ca || 3.41 ||
translation_danish:
[3.41] Yogiens bindu[^128] flyder ikke fra drøbelen - selv i en
lidenskabelig kvindes omfavnelse - når rummet er forseglet med
Khecarī-mudrā.[^129]
translation_english: NA
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^128]: Bindu, "mandens sæd".
[^129]: I den tidlige haṭhayogiske forståelse af khecarī-mudrā er der tale om en præventiv teknik (bindudhāraṇa) til at fastholde sæden (bindu) i hovedet ved at lukke ganesejlet med tungen. Ved at skære membranen over, der holder tungen fast i undermunden (frenulum linguae), kan tungen gradvist strækkes og forlænges med henblik på at stikke den tilbage i ganen og op i hulrummet i kraniet, hvorved det forsegles.

sanskrit:
चलितोऽपि यदा बिन्दुः सम्प्राप्तो योनिमण्डलम् ।
व्रजत्यूर्ध्वं हृतः शक्त्या निबद्धो योनिमुद्रया ॥४२॥
transliteration:
calito 'pi yadā binduḥ samprāpto yonimaṇḍalam |
vrajaty ūrdhvaṃ hr̥taḥ śaktyā nibaddho yonimudrayā || 3.42 ||
translation_danish:
[3.42] Når en vildfaren bindu når frem til en vagina, opfanges det
tabte af Yonimudrāen[^130] og føres kraftfuldt opad.
translation_english: [3.42] The Siddhas have devised this Khechari Mudrā from the fact that the mind and the tongue reach ākāśa by its practice.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^130]: Yonimudrā kan være en reference til den yogiske teknik Vajrolīmudrā (jf. Śivasaṃhitā, kap. 4). Denne hydrauliske sugeteknik kan både udføres af mænd og kvinder med henblik på at holde vitale kropsvæsker i sig, så som den mandlige sæd (bindu) og den kvindelige sæd (rajas). En tvetydighed i verset anes, idet der enten er tale om en yogi, som ved 'damage control' opfanger sin tabte bindu, eller en kvinde, der opfanger og benytter sig af mandens tabte bindu - på mandens bekostning.

sanskrit:
ऊर्ध्वजिह्वः स्थिरो भूत्वा सोमपानं करोति यः ।
मासार्धेन न सन्देहो मृत्युं जयति योगवित् ॥४३॥
अथ खेचरी
transliteration:
ūrdhvajihvaḥ sthiro bhūtvā somapānaṃ karoti yaḥ |
māsārdhena na sandeho mr̥tyuṃ jayati yogavit || 3.43 ||
translation_danish:
[3.43] Den yogakender, som placerer tungen solidt foroven og drikker
månenektar,[^131] overvinder uden tvivl døden på en halv måned.
translation_english: [3.43] If the hole behind the palate be stopped with Khechari by turning the tongue upwards, then bindu cannot leave its place even if a woman were embraced.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^131]: Månenektar er soma, hvilket her refererer til den indre udødelighedsnektar (bindu eller amr̥ta).

sanskrit:
नित्यं सोमकलापूर्णं शरीरं यस्य योगिनः ।
तक्षकेणापि दष्टस्य विषं तस्य​ न सर्पति ॥४४॥
transliteration:
nityaṃ somakalāpūrṇaṃ śarīraṃ yasya yoginaḥ |
takṣakeṇāpi daṣṭasya viṣaṃ tasya na sarpati || 3.44 ||
translation_danish:
[3.44] Gift fra bid, selv fra Takṣaka-slangen,[^132] spreder sig ikke
i den yogis krop, som vedvarende fyldes med månedråber.
translation_english: [3.44] If the Yogī drinks Somarasa (juice) by sitting with the tongue turned backwards and mind concentrated, there is no doubt he conquers death within 15 days.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^132]: Takṣaka-slangen er en mytologisk slangekonge (nagarāja), som er den giftigste slange. Slangekongen Takṣaka kendes både fra hinduismen og buddhismen og er omtalt i Mahābhārata-eposet.

sanskrit:
इन्धनानि यथा वह्निस्तैलवर्ति च दीपकः ।
तथा सोमकलापूर्णं देही देहं न मुञ्चति ॥४५॥
transliteration:
indhanāni yathā vahnis tailavarti ca dīpikaḥ |
tathā somakalāpūrṇaṃ dehī dehaṃ na muñcati || 3.45 ||
translation_danish:
[3.45] Som ilden og brændslet, flammen og olievægen,
således udslukkes selvet ikke i den krop, som fyldes med
månedråber.[^133]
translation_english: [3.45] If the Yogī, whose body is full of Somarasa (juice), were bitten by Takshaka (snake), its poison cannot permeate his body. [3.45] As fire is inseparably connected with the wood and light is connected with the wick and oil, so does the soul not leave the body full of nectar exuding from the Soma. [3.45] Note.—Soma (Chandra) is described later on located in the thousand-petalled lotus in the human brain, and is the same as is seen on Śivas’ head in pictures, and from which a sort of juice exudes. It is the retaining of this exudation which makes one immortal.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^133]: Verset skal forstås således, at ilden ikke slukkes, hvis den konstant fodres med brændsel; ligeså 'slukkes' den yogiske krop heller ikke, hvis den konstant næres med 'månedråber', dvs. den indre udødelighedsnektar (bindu eller amr̥ta).

sanskrit:
गोमांसं भक्षयेन्नित्यं पिबेदमरवारुणीम् ।
कुलीनं तमहं मन्ये इतरे कुलघातकाः ॥४६॥
transliteration:
gomāṃsaṃ bhakṣayen nityaṃ pibed amaravāruṇīm |
kulīnaṃ tam ahaṃ manye itare kulaghātakāḥ || 3.46 ||
translation_danish:
[3.46] Yogien bør hver dag spise kokød og drikke guddommelig vin. Jeg
anser ham for at være af god familie; de andre ødelægger familien.
translation_english: [3.46] Those who eat the flesh of the cow and drink the immortal liquor daily, are regarded by me men of noble family. Others are but a disgrace to their families. [2]

sanskrit:
गोशब्देनोदिता जिह्वा तत्प्रवेशो हि तालुनि ।
गोमांसभक्षणं तत्तु महापातकनाशनम् ॥४७॥
transliteration:
gośabdenoditā jihvā tat praveśo hi tāluni |
gomāṃsabhakṣaṇaṃ tat tu mahāpātakanāśanam || 3.47 ||
translation_danish:
[3.47] Med ordet "ko" menes der tunge. Dens indtrængen i ganen er at
spise kokød. Dette eliminerer de største synder.[^134]
translation_english: NA
footnotes_translation_danish: [^134]: Der er fem store synder (mahāpātaka): at dræbe en brahmin, at drikke berusende drikke, begå tyveri, begå utroskab med en religiøs lærers hustru og at omgås enhver, der har gjort sig skyldig i en af disse synder.

sanskrit:
जिह्वाप्रवेशसम्भूतवह्निनोत्पादितः खलु ।
चन्द्रात्स्रवति यः सारः सा स्यादमरवारुणी ॥४८॥
transliteration:
jihvāpraveśasambhūtavahninotpāditaḥ khalu |
candrāt sravati yaḥ sāraḥ sā syād amaravāruṇī || 3.48 ||
translation_danish:
[3.48] Den nektar, som flyder fra månen er foranlediget af ilden. Den
frembringes ved tungens indtrængen i ganen. Dette er den guddommelige
vin.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit:
चुम्बन्ती यदि लम्बिकाग्रमनिशं जिह्वारसस्यन्दिनी
सक्षारा कटुकाम्लदुग्धसदृशी मध्वाज्यतुल्या तथा ।
व्याधीनां हरणं जरान्तकरणं शस्त्रागमोदीरणम्
तस्य स्यादमरत्वमष्टगुणितं सिद्धाङ्गनाकर्षणम् ॥४९॥
transliteration:
cumbantī yadi lambikāgram aniśaṃ jihvārasasyandinī
sakṣārā kaṭukāmladugdhasadr̥śī madhvājyatulyā tathā |
vyādhīnāṃ haraṇaṃ jarāntakaraṇaṃ śastrāgamodīraṇam
tasya syād amaratvam aṣṭaguṇitaṃ siddhāṅganākarṣaṇam || 3.49 ||
translation_danish:
[3.49] Hvis tungen vedvarende berører det inderste af ganen og
overstrømmes af nektar, som er salt, bitter og sur og ligner mælk og har
samme substans som honning og ghee, vil yogien tilegne sig følgende:
sundhed, ungdommelighed, usårlighed, udødelighed, de otte siddhier[^135]
og tiltrækning af fuldkomne kvinder.[^136]
translation_english: [3.49] Immortal liquor is the nectar exuding from the moon (Chandra situated on the left side of the space between the eyebrows). It is produced by the fire which is generated by thrusting the tongue.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^135]: De otte siddhier, "yogiske kræfter", er evnen til at (1) blive helt lille (aṇimā), (2) blive kæmpestor (mahimā), (3) blive meget tung (garimā), (4) blive meget let (laghimā), (5) være hvor man vil (prāpti), (6) få opfyldt alle ønsker (prākāmya), (7) få magt over naturen (īśitva) og (8) få magt over andre (vaśitva).
[^136]: I denne kontekst kan der både være tale om smukke eller 'fuldkomne' (siddha) jordiske kvinder eller overnaturlige kvindelige væsener (yoginīer).

sanskrit:
ऊर्ध्वः षोडशपत्रमध्य​गलितं प्राणादवाप्तं हठात्
ऊर्ध्वास्यो रसनां नियम्य विवरे शक्तिं परां चिन्तयन् ।
उत्कल्लोलकलाजलं च विमलं धारामयं यः पिबेत्
निर्व्याधिः स मृणालकोमलवपुर्योगी चिरं जीवति ॥५०॥
transliteration:
ūrdhvaḥ ṣoḍaśapatramadhyagalitaṃ prāṇād avāptaṃ haṭhāt
ūrdvhāsyo rasanāṃ niyamya vivare śaktiṃ parāṃ cintayan |
utkallolakalājalaṃ ca vimalaṃ dhārāmayaṃ yaḥ pibet
nirvyādhiḥ sa mr̥ṇālakomalavapur yogī ciraṃ jīvati || 3.50 ||
translation_danish:
[3.50] Den udstrakte yogi,[^137] som mediterer på śakti, mens han
placerer den opadrettede tunge i hulrummet[^138] og drikker den klare
strøm af sædlignende væske frembragt ved prāṇa og haṭhayoga, som flyder
mod midten af den sekstenbladede lotus,[^139] han lever længe og uden
sygdom med en krop så delikat som stilken på en lotus.
translation_english: [3.50] If the tongue can touch with its end the hole from which falls the rasa (juice) which is saltish, bitter, sour, milky and similar to ghee and [3.50] honey, one can drive away disease, destroy old age, can evade an attack of arms, become immortal in eight ways and can attract fairies.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^137]: Dvs. en yogi i hovedstanden Viparītakaraṇī.
[^138]: Tungeteknikken Khecarīmudrā.
[^139]: Den sekstenbladede lotus er en reference til Viśuddhi-cakraet placeret i struben.

sanskrit:
यत्प्रालेयं प्रहितसुषिरं मेरुमूर्धान्तरस्थम्
तस्मिंस्तत्त्वं प्रवदति सुधीस्तन्मुखं निम्नगानाम् ।
चन्द्रात्सारः स्रवति वपुषस्तेन मृत्युर्नराणाम्
तद्बध्नीयात्सुकरणमथो नान्यथा कार्यसिद्धिः॥५१॥
transliteration:
yat prāleyaṃ prahitasuṣiraṃ merumūrdhāntarastham
tasmiṃs tattvaṃ pravadati sudhīs tanmukhaṃ nimnagānām |
candrāt sāraḥ sravati vapuṣas tena mr̥tyur narāṇām
tad badhnīyāt sukaraṇam atho nānyathā kāryasiddhiḥ || 3.51 ||
translation_danish:
[3.51] Den vise stadfæster, at duggen, som strømmer fra hulrummet i
Merubjergets top,[^140] er den højeste virkelighed og den ypperste
blandt floder. Mennesket dør ved at kroppens essens strømmer fra månen.
Hold derfor fast i den gunstige teknik. Kroppen kan ikke perfektioneres
på anden vis.
translation_english: [3.51] He who drinks the clear stream of liquor of the moon (soma) falling from the brain to the sixteen-petalled lotus (in the heart), obtained by means of Prāṇa, by applying the tongue to the hole of the pendant in the palate, and by meditating on the great power (Kuṇḍalinī), becomes free from disease and tender in body, like the stalk of a lotus, and the Yogī lives a very long life.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^140]: Merubjerget er et mytologisk bjerg og en verdensakse i en række indiske religioner. Gangesfloden siges at have sit udspring fra toppen af Meru før den deler sig i en række mindre floder. Her lignes kroppens hoved med Merubjerget og strømmen af nektar (amṛta) med Gangesfloden. Hulrummet i Merubjerget er en pendant til Vyoma-cakraet, hvor kroppens kanaler (nāḍīer) mødes (3.36).

sanskrit:
सुषिरं ज्ञानजनकं पञ्चस्रोतःसमन्वितम् ।
तिष्ठते खेचरी मुद्रा तस्मिञ्शून्ये निरञ्जने ॥५२॥
transliteration:
suṣiraṃ jñānajanakaṃ pañcasrotaḥsamanvitam |
tiṣṭhate khecarī mudrā tasmiñ śūnye nirañjane || 3.52 ||
translation_danish:
[3.52] Hulrummet afføder visdom og er forbundet med de fem floder. I
den rene tomhed befinder Khecarīmudrā sig.
translation_english: [3.52] On the top of the Merū (vertebral column), concealed in a hole, is the Somarasa (nectar of Chandra); the wise, whose intellect is not overpowered by Raja and Tama guṇas, but in whom Satwa guṇa is predominant, say there is the (universal spirit) ātma in it. It is the source of the down-going Idā, Pingalā and Suṣumnā Nādis, which are the Ganges, the Yamuna and the Sarasvati. From that Chandra is shed the essence of the body which causes death of men. It should, therefore, be stopped from shedding. This (Khechari Mudrā) is a very good instrument for this purpose. There is no other means of achieving this end.

sanskrit:
एकं सृष्टिमयं बीजमेका मुद्रा च खेचरी ।
एको देवो निरालम्ब एकावस्था मनोन्मनी ॥५३॥
transliteration:
ekaṃ sr̥ṣṭimayaṃ bījam ekā mudrā ca khecarī |
eko devo nirālamba ekāvasthā manonmanī || 3.53 ||
translation_english: [3.53] This hole is the generator of knowledge and is the source of the five streams (Idā, Pingalā, &c.). In that colorless vacuum, Khecharī Mudrā should be established.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^141]: Manonmanī-stadiet er en tilstand af fuldstændig sinds- og kropsro samt dybdekoncentration, hvor al opmærksomhed rettes mod et enkelt punkt (ekāgratā).

sanskrit:
अथोड्डीयानबन्धः
बद्धो येन सुषुम्नायां प्रणस्तूड्डीयते यतः ।
तस्मादुड्डीयानाख्योऽयं योगिभिः समुदाहृतः ॥५४॥
transliteration:
athoḍḍīyānabandhaḥ
baddho yena suṣumṇāyāṃ prāṇas tūḍḍīyate yataḥ |
tasmād uḍḍīyānākhyo'yaṃ yogibhiḥ samudāhr̥taḥ || 3.54 ||
translation_danish:
[3.54] Prāṇaen bindes og flyver op i Suṣumnā i kraft af bandhaen kendt
som Uḍḍīyana-bandha. Derfor kaldes den dette af yogierne.[^142]
translation_english: [3.54] There is only one seed germinating the whole universe from it; and there is only one Mudrā, called Khecharī. There is only one deva (god) without any one's support, and there is one condition called Manonmaṇi.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^142]: Uḍḍīyana betyder "opadflyvende" og der er således tale om et ordspil. Uḍḍīyana staves i sanskritteksten konsekvent uḍḍīyāna, hvilket er en stavefejl.

sanskrit:
उड्डीनं कुरुते यस्मादविश्रान्तं महाखगः ।
उड्डीयानं तदेव स्यात्तत्र बन्धोऽभिधीयते ॥५५॥
transliteration:
uḍḍīnaṃ kurute yasmād aviśrāntaṃ mahākhagaḥ |
uḍḍīyānaṃ tad eva syāt tatra bandho'bhidhīyate || 3.55 ||
translation_danish:
[3.55] Den, som uafbrudt får den store fugl[^143] til at flyve opad,
det er Uḍḍīyana. Nu er bandhaen forklaret.
translation_english: [3.55] Uḍḍiyāna is so called, because the great bird, Prāṇa, tied to it, flies without being fatigued. It is explained below.

sanskrit:
उदरे पश्चिमं तानं नाभेरूर्ध्वं च कारयेत् ।
उड्डीयानो ह्यसौ बम्धो मृत्युमातङ्गकेसरी ॥५६॥
transliteration:
udare paścimaṃ tānaṃ nābher ūrdhvaṃ ca kārayet |
uḍḍīyāno hy asau bandho mr̥tyumātaṅgakesarī || 3.56 ||
translation_danish:
[3.56] Maven trækkes bagud og navlen opad. Uḍḍīyana-bandha er i
sandhed løven, der dræber dødens elefant.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit:
उड्डीयानं तु सहजं गुरुणा कथितं यथा ।
अभ्यसेत्सततं यस्तु वृद्धोऽपि तरुणायते ॥५७॥
transliteration:
uḍḍīyānaṃ tu sahajaṃ guruṇā kathitaṃ yathā |
abhyaset satataṃ yas tu vr̥ddho'pi taruṇāyate || 3.57 ||
translation_danish:
[3.57] Den yogi, som vedvarende og naturligt praktiserer Uḍḍīyana, som
foreskrevet af en guru, bliver ung, om end han er gammel.
translation_english: [3.57] The belly above the navel is pressed backwards towards the spine. This Uḍḍiyāna Bandha is like a lion for the elephant of death.

sanskrit:
नाभेरूर्ध्वमधश्चापि तानं कुर्यात्प्रयत्नतः ।
षण्मासमभ्यसेन्मृत्युं जयत्येव न संशयः ॥५८॥
transliteration:
nābher ūrdhvam adhaś cāpi tānaṃ kuryāt prayatnataḥ |
ṣaṇmāsam abhyasen mr̥tyuṃ jayaty eva na saṃśayaḥ || 3.58 ||
translation_danish:
[3.58] Han trækker ind over og under navlen. Yogien bør praktisere
ihærdigt i seks måneder. Derved overvinder han døden. Herom er der ingen
tvivl.
translation_english: [3.58] Uḍḍiyāna is always very easy, when learnt from a guru. The practiser of this, if old, becomes young again. [3.58] The portions above and below the navel, should be drawn backwards towards the spine. By practising this for six months one can undoubtedly conquer death.

sanskrit:
सर्वेषामेव बन्धानामुत्तमो ह्युड्डियानकः ।
उड्डियाने दृढे बन्धे मुक्तिः स्वाभाविकी भवेत् ॥५९॥
transliteration:
sarveṣām eva bandhānā uttamo hy uḍḍīyānakaḥ |
uḍḍiyāne dr̥ḍhe bandhe muktiḥ svābhāvikī bhavet || 3.59 ||
translation_danish:
[3.59] Uḍḍīyana er i sandhed den bedste bandha. Når Uḍḍīyanabandhaen
mestres, følger mukti[^144] naturligt.
Dette er Mūlabandha:
translation_english: NA

sanskrit:
अथ मूलबन्धः
पार्ष्णिभागेन सम्पीड्य​ योनिमाकुञ्चयेद्गुदम् ।
अपानमूर्ध्वमाकृष्य मूलबन्धोऽभिधीयते ॥६०॥
transliteration:
atha mūlabandhaḥ
pārṣṇibhāgena sampīḍya yonim ākuñcayed gudam |
apānam ūrdhvam ākr̥ṣya mūlabandho'bhidhīyate || 3.60 ||
translation_danish:
[3.60] Hælen presses mod stedet, hvor skeden er placeret.[^145] Træk
anus sammen. Træk apāna opad. Dette kaldes Mūlabandha.
translation_english: [3.60] Of all the Bandhas, Uḍḍiyāna is the best; for by binding it firmly liberation comes spontaneously. [3.60] Pressing Yoni (perineum) with the heel, contract up the anus. By drawing the Apāna thus, Mūla Bandha is made.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^145]: Dvs. mellemkødet (perineum) mellem anus og skrotum.

sanskrit:
अधोगतिमपानं वै ऊर्ध्वगं कुरुते बलात् ।
आकुञ्चनेन तं प्राहुर्मूलबन्धं हि योगिनः ॥६१॥
transliteration:
adhogatim apānaṃ vai ūrdhvagaṃ kurute balāt |
ākuñcanena taṃ prāhur mūlabandhaṃ hi yoginaḥ || 3.61 ||
translation_danish:
[3.61] Ved en kraftfuld sammentrækning får yogien apāna, der går
nedad, til at gå opad. Yogierne kalder den for Mūlabandha.
translation_english: [3.61] The Apāna, naturally inclining downward, is made to go up by force. This Mūla Bandha is spoken of by Yogīs as done by contracting the anus.

sanskrit:
गुदं पार्ष्ण्य तु सम्पीड्य योनिमाकुञ्चयेद्बलात् ।
वारं वारं यथा चोर्ध्वं समायाति समीरणः ॥६२॥
transliteration:
gudaṃ pārṣṇyā tu sampīḍya yonim ākuñcayed balāt |
vāraṃ vāraṃ yathā cordhvaṃ samāyāti samīraṇaḥ || 3.62 ||
translation_danish:
[3.62] Hælen presses mod anus og stedet for skeden trækkes kraftfuldt
sammen gentagne gange, så vinden går opad.
translation_english: [3.62] Pressing the heel well against the anus, draw up the air by force, again and again till it (air) goes up.

sanskrit:
प्राणापानौ नादबिन्दू मूलबन्धेन चैकताम् ।
गत्वा योगस्य संसिद्धिं यच्छतो नात्र संशयः ॥६३॥
transliteration:
prāṇāpānau nādabindū mūlabandhena caikatām |
gatvā yogasya saṃsiddhiṃ yacchato nātra saṃśayaḥ || 3.63 ||
translation_danish:
[3.63] Når prāṇa og apāna, nāda og bindu forenes ved hjælp af
Mūlabandha leder de til fuldkommen succes i yoga. Herom er der ingen
tvivl.
translation_english: [3.63] Prāṇa, Apāna, Nāda and Bindu uniting into one in this way, give success in Yoga, undoubtedly.

sanskrit:
अपानप्राणयोरैक्यं क्षयो मूत्रपुरीषयोः ।
युवा भवति वृद्धोऽपि सततं मूलबन्धनात् ॥६४॥
transliteration:
apānaprāṇayor aikyaṃ kṣayo mūtrapurīṣayoḥ |
yuvā bhavati vr̥ddho'pi satataṃ mūlabandhanāt || 3.64 ||
translation_danish:
[3.64] Ved at praktisere Mūlabandha regelmæssigt bliver apāna og prāṇa
én; urin og afføring aftager; selv den gamle bliver ung.
translation_english: [3.64] By the purification of Prāṇa, and Apāna, urine and excrements decrease. Even an old man becomes young by constantly practising Mūla Bandha.

sanskrit:
अपाने ऊर्ध्वगे जाते प्रयाते वह्निमण्डलम् ।
तदानलशिखा दीर्घा जायते वायुनाहता ॥६५॥
transliteration:
apāne ūrdhvage jāte prayāte vahnimaṇḍalam |
tadānalaśikhā dīrghā jāyate vāyunāhatā || 3.65 ||
translation_danish:
[3.65] Når udåndingen bevæger sig opad, sættes fordøjelsens ild i
gang. Den blusser op og rammer Vāyuna.[^146]
translation_english: [3.65] Going up, the Apāna enters the zone of fire, i.e., the stomach. The flame of fire struck by the air is thereby lengthened. [3]
footnotes_translation_danish: [^146]: Vāyuna relaterer til luft og er navnet på en guddom. Formodentlig refereres der her til Anāhata-cakraet, som også er homolog til luftens element.

sanskrit:
ततो यातो वह्न्यपानौ प्राणमुष्णस्वरूपकम् ।
तेनात्यन्तप्रदीप्तस्तु ज्वलनो देहजस्तथा ॥६६॥
transliteration:
tato yāto vahnyapānau prāṇam uṣṇasvarūpakam |
tenātyantapradīptas tu jvalano dehajas tathā || 3.66 ||
translation_danish:
[3.66] Kroppens varme forøges drastisk, når fordøjelsens ild og apāna
mødes med prāṇa, der er varm af natur.
translation_english: [3.66] These, fire and Apāna, go to the naturally hot Prāṇa, which, becoming inflamed thereby, causes burning sensation in the body.

sanskrit:
तेन कुण्डलिनी सुप्ता सन्त​प्ता सम्प्र​बुध्यते ।
दण्डाहता भुजङ्गीव निःश्वस्य ऋजुतां व्रजेत् ॥६७॥
transliteration:
tena kuṇḍalinī suptā santaptā samprabudhyate |
daṇḍāhatā bhujaṅgīva niḥśvasya r̥jutāṃ vrajet || 3.67 ||
translation_danish:
[3.67] Som følge af denne varme vækkes den sovende Kuṇḍalinī, der
hvæser og retter sig ud, som en slange ramt af en stok.
translation_english: [3.67] The Kuṇḍalinī, which has been sleeping all this time, becomes well heated by this means and awakens well. It becomes straight like a serpent, struck dead with a stick.

sanskrit:
बिलं प्रविष्टेव ततो ब्रह्मनाड्यन्तरं व्रजेत् ।
तस्मान्नित्यं मूलबन्धः कर्तव्यो योगिभिः सदा ॥६८॥
transliteration:
bilaṃ praviṣṭeva tato brahmanāḍyantaraṃ vrajet |
tasmān nityaṃ mūlabandhaḥ kartavyo yogibhiḥ sadā || 3.68 ||
translation_danish:
[3.68] Hun bevæger sig dermed ind i brahman-kanalen,[^147] som trådte
hun ind i en hule. Yogierne bør derfor udføre Mūlabandha dagligt.
Dette er Jālandharabandha:
translation_english: [3.68] It enters the Brahma Nādī, just as a serpent enters its hole. Therefore, the Yogī should always practise this Mūla Bandha.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^147]: Brahmanāḍī, 'Brahman-kanalen', er et synonym for Suṣumnā-kanalen, idet den fører yogien til brahman.

sanskrit:
अथ जालन्धरबन्धः
कण्ठमाकुञ्च्य हृदये स्थापयेच्चिबुकं दृढम् ।
बन्धो जालन्धराख्योऽयं जरामृत्युविनाशकः ॥६९॥
transliteration:
atha jālandharabandhaḥ
kaṇṭham ākuñcya hr̥daye sthāpayec cibukaṃ dr̥ḍham |
bandho jālandharākhyo'yaṃ jarāmr̥tyuvināśakaḥ || 3.69 ||
translation_danish:
[3.69] Nakken bøjes og hagen placeres tæt ind mod hjertet. Bandhaen
kaldes Jālandharabandha. Den udsletter alderdom og død.
translation_english: [3.69] The Jālandhara Bandha.

sanskrit:
बध्नाति हि शिराजालमधोगामिनभोजलम् ।
ततो जालन्धरो बन्धः कण्ठदुःखौघनाशनः ॥७०॥
transliteration:
badhnāti hi śirājālam adhogāminabhojalam |
tato jālandharo bandhaḥ kaṇṭhaduḥkhaughanāśanaḥ || 3.70 ||
translation_danish:
[3.70] Den lukker for netværket af floder med nedstrømmende himmelsk
vand. Dermed udsletter Jālandharabandha de mange plager i halsen.
translation_english: [3.70] Contract the throat and press the chin firmly against the chest. This is called Jālandhara Bandha, which destroys old age and death.

sanskrit:
जालन्धरे कृते बन्धे कण्ठसंकोचलक्षने ।
न पीयूषं पतत्यग्नौ न च वायुः प्रकुप्यति ॥७१॥
transliteration:
jālandhare kr̥te bandhe kaṇṭhasaṃkocalakṣaṇe |
na pīyūṣaṃ pataty agnau na ca vāyuḥ prakupyati || 3.71 ||
translation_danish:
[3.71] Når man udfører Jālandharabandha, hvis kendetegn er en
sammentrækning i halsen, forsvinder nektaren ikke ned i ilden og
åndedrættet ophidses ikke.
translation_english: [3.71] It stops the opening (hole) of the group of the Nādīs, through which the juice from the sky (from the Soma or Chandra in the brain) falls down. It is, therefore, called the Jālandhara Bandha —the destroyer of a host of diseases of the throat.

sanskrit:
कण्ठसंकोचनेनैव द्वे नाड्यौ स्तम्भयेद्दृढम् ।
मध्यचक्रमिदं ज्ञेयं षोडशाधारबन्धनम् ॥७२॥
transliteration:
kaṇṭhasaṃkocanenaiva dve nāḍyau stambhayed dr̥ḍham |
madhyacakram idaṃ jñeyaṃ ṣoḍaśādhārabandhanam || 3.72 ||
translation_danish:
[3.72] Denne sammentrækning i halsen blokerer de to nāḍīer. Her er det
midterste cakra,[^148] der forbinder de seksten ādhāraer.[^149]
translation_english: [3.72] In Jālandhara Bandha, the indications of a perfect contraction of throat are, that the nectar does not fall into the fire (the Sūrya situated in the navel), and the air is not disturbed.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^148]: Også kendt som Viśuddhi-cakra.
[^149]: De seksten ādhāraer, 'fikspunkter' eller 'kronblade', fungerer som meditationsobjekter i den tantriske kropsforståelse (esoterisk anatomi). Lokationerne for de seksten ādhāraer eller fikspunkter oplistes i Lonāvlā-versionens hindī-kommentar: 1) storetå, 2) ankel, 3) knæ, 4) lår, 5) perineum , 6) genitalier, 7) navle, 8) hjerte, 9) nakke, 10) halsregion, 11) drøbel, 12) næse, 13) mellem øjenbrynene, 14) pande, 15) hovedet og 16) kronen (brahmarandhra).

sanskrit:
मूलस्थानं समाकुञ्च्य उड्डियानं तु कारयेत् ।
इडां च पिङ्गलां बद्ध्वा वाहयेत्पश्चिमे पथि ॥७३॥
transliteration:
mūlasthānaṃ samākuñcya uḍḍiyānaṃ tu kārayet |
iḍāṃ ca piṅgalāṃ baddhvā vāhayet paścime pathi || 3.73 ||
translation_danish:
[3.73] Træk bækkenbunden sammen og udfør Uḍḍīyanabandha. Blokér Iḍā og
Piṅgalā og benyt den sidste vej.[^150]
translation_english: [3.73] The two Nādīs should be stopped firmly by contracting the throat. This is called the middle circuit or centre (Madhya Chakra), and it stops the 16 ādhāras (i.e., vital parts). [4]
footnotes_translation_danish: [^150]: Den sidste vej er en reference til Suṣumnā-kanalen.

sanskrit:
अनेनैव विधानेन प्रयाति पवनो लयम् ।
ततो न जायते मृत्युर्जरारोगादिकं तथा ॥७४॥
transliteration:
anenaiva vidhānena prayāti pavano layam |
tato na jāyate mr̥tyur jarārogādikaṃ tathā || 3.74 ||
translation_danish:
[3.74] Ved hjælp af denne teknik vandrer åndedrættet derhen. Herefter
opstår sygdom, alderdom og død med videre ikke længere.
translation_english: [3.74] By drawing up the mūlasthāna (anus,) Uḍḍiyāna Bandha should be performed. The flow of the air should be directed to the Suṣumnā, by closing the Idā, and the Pingalā.

sanskrit:
बन्धत्रयमिदं श्रेष्ठं महासिद्धैश्च सेवितम् ।
सर्वेषां हठतन्त्राणां साधनं योगिनो विदुः ॥७५॥
transliteration:
bandhatrayam idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ mahāsiddhaiś ca sevitam |
sarveṣāṃ haṭhatantrāṇāṃ sādhanaṃ yogino viduḥ || 3.75 ||
translation_danish:
[3.75] Disse tre bandhaer er de ypperste, som de store siddhaer dvæler
ved.
De fuldender al haṭha-tantrisk praksis. Det ved yogierne.
Dette er Viparītakaraṇī:
translation_english: [3.75] The Prāna becomes calm and latent by this means, and thus there is no death, old age, disease, etc.

sanskrit:
अथ विपरीतकरणी |
यत्किञ्चित्स्रवते चन्द्रादमृतं दिव्यरूपिणः ।
तत्सर्वं ग्रसते सूर्यस्तेन पिण्डो जरायुतः ॥७६॥
transliteration:
atha viparītakaraṇī |
yat kiñcit sravate candrād amr̥taṃ divyarūpiṇaḥ |
tat sarvaṃ grasate sūryas tena piṇḍo jarāyutaḥ || 3.76 ||
translation_danish:
[3.76] Solen sluger al nektar, som undslipper den guddommelige måne.
Kroppens aldring er forbundet med dette.
translation_english: [3.76] These three Bandhas are the best of all and have been practised by the masters. Of all the means of success in the Haṭha Yoga, they are known to the Yogīs as the chief ones.

sanskrit:
तत्रास्ति करणं दिव्यं सूर्यस्य मुखवञ्चनम् ।
गुरूपदेशतो ज्ञेयं न तु शास्त्रार्थकोटिभिः ॥७७॥
transliteration:
tatrāsti karaṇaṃ divyaṃ sūryasya mukhavañcanam |
gurūpadeśato jñeyaṃ na tu śāstrārthakoṭibhiḥ || 3.77 ||
translation_danish:
[3.77] Der findes en guddommelig teknik, som snyder solens gab. Den
skal læres ved en gurus instruktioner; ikke ved ti millioner tekstlige
udlægninger.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit:
ऊर्ध्वनाभेरधस्तालोरूर्ध्वं भानुरधः शशी ।
करणी विपरीताख्या गुरुवाक्येन लभ्यते ॥७८॥
transliteration:
ūrdhvanābher adhas tālor ūrdhvaṃ bhānur adhaḥ śaśī |
karaṇī viparītākhyā guruvākyena labhyate || 3.78 ||
translation_danish:
[3.78] Navlen op, ganen ned; solen op, månen ned. Teknikken kaldes
Viparīta[^151] og mestres ved hjælp af guruens instruktioner.
translation_english: [3.78] Above the navel and below the palate respectively, are the Sūrya and the Chandra. The exercise, called the Viparīta Karaṇī, is learnt from the guru's instructions.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^151]: Viparīta-karaṇī, 'Den omvendte teknik', er en hovedstandsteknik med henblik på at holde sæden i hovedet (bindudhāraṇa) for at undgå at livsenergien (bindu) drypper fra månen i hovedet og ned i solen i maveregionen, hvor den brænder op.

sanskrit:
नित्यमभ्यासयुक्तस्य जठराग्निविवर्धिनी ।
