[4.69] Der bør være fire stadier[^209] i alle former for yoga:
begyndelsesstadiet Ārambha, krukkestadiet Ghaṭa, opfyldningsstadiet
Paricaya og fuldendelsesstadiet Niṣpatti.
Dette er begyndelsesstadiet Ārambha:
translation_english: [4.69] In all the Yogas, there are four states: (1) ārambha or the preliminary, (2) Ghata, or the state of a jar, (3) Parichaya (known), (4) niṣpatti (consumate.)
footnotes_translation_danish: [^209]: Disse stadier forstås også som tilstande (āvasthā).

sanskrit:
अथारम्भावस्था
ब्रह्मग्रन्थेर्भवेद्भेदादानन्दः शून्यसम्भवः ।
विचित्रः क्वणको देहेऽनाहतः श्रूयते ध्वनिः ॥७०॥
transliteration:
atha ārambhāvasthā
brahmagranther bhaved bhedānandaḥ śūnyasambhavaḥ |
vicitraḥ kvaṇako dehe'nāhataḥ śrūyate dhvaniḥ || 4.70 ||
translation_danish:
[4.70] Idet Brahmās knude[^210] splittes høres en evig lyd i kroppen,
der aldrig er slået an. Denne lyd er en frydefuld, farverig klingren som
findes i tomrummet.
translation_english: [4.70] When the Brahma granthi (in the heart) is pierced through by Prāṇāyāma, then a sort of happiness is experienced in the vacuum of the heart, and the anāhat sounds, like various tinkling sounds of ornaments, are heard in the body.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^210]: Brahmās knude antages af nogle at være placeret i rodcakraet og af andre i hjertet. I dette tilfælde er Brahmās knude placeret i hjertet, Viṣṇus knude i struben og Rudras knude mellem øjenbrynene.

sanskrit:
दिव्यदेहश्च तेजस्वी दिव्यगन्धस्त्वरोगवान् ।
सम्पूर्णहृदयः शून्य आरम्भे योगवान्भवेत् ॥७१॥
transliteration:
divyadehaś ca tejasvī divyagandhas tvarogavān |
sampūrṇahr̥dayaḥ śūnya ārambhe yogavān bhavet || 4.71 ||
translation_danish:
[4.71] I begyndelsesstadiet opnår den, der praktiserer yoga, en
guddommelig krop, som er kraftfuld og fri for sygdomme, tom, med en
guddommelig duft og et fyldt hjerte.
Dette er krukkestadiet Ghaṭa:
translation_english: [4.71] In the ārambha, a Yogī's body becomes divine, glowing, healthy, and emits a divine swell. The whole of his heart becomes void.

sanskrit:
अथ घटावस्था
द्वितीयायां घटीकृत्य वायुर्भवति मध्यगः ।
दृढासनो भवेद्योगी ज्ञानी देवसमस्तथा ॥७२॥
transliteration:
atha ghaṭāvasthā
dvitīyāyāṃ ghaṭīkr̥tya vāyur bhavati madhyagaḥ |
dr̥ḍhāsano bhaved yogī jñānī devasamas tathā || 4.72 ||
translation_danish:
[4.72] I det andet stadie, efter at have udført en kumbhaka,[^211]
ledes åndedrættet ind i midterste kanal. En yogi vil da være fast
forankret i āsanaerne, klog og lig guderne.
translation_english: [4.72] In the second stage, the airs are united into one and begin moving in the middle channel. The Yogī's posture becomes firm, and he becomes wise like a god.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^211]: Kumbhaka, 'krukke'. En åndedrætsteknik, hvor man holder vejret og omdanner lungerne til en 'krukke' eller 'gryde' af luft.

sanskrit:
विष्णुग्रन्थेस्ततो भेदात्परमानन्दसूचकः ।
अतिशून्ये विमर्दश्च भेरीशब्दस्तदा भवेत् ॥७३॥
transliteration:
viṣṇugranthes tato bhedāt paramānandasūcakaḥ |
atiśūnye vimardaś ca bherīśabdas tadā bhavet || 4.73 ||
translation_danish:
[4.73] I kraft af splittelsen af Viṣṇus knude opstår en dunkende lyd
af en pauke i tomrummet, der er et udtryk for den højeste form for fryd.
Dette er opfyldningsstadiet Paricaya:
translation_english: [4.73] By this means the Viṣṇu knot (in the throat) is pierced which is indicated by highest pleasure experienced, And then the Bherī sound (like the beating of a kettle drain) is evolved in the vacuum in the throat.

sanskrit:
अथ परिचयावस्था
तृतीयायां तु विज्ञेयो विहायोमर्दलध्वनिः ।
महाशून्यं तदा याति सर्वसिद्धिसमाश्रयम् ॥७४॥
transliteration:
atha paricayāvasthā
tr̥tīyāyāṃ tu vijñeyo vihāyo mardaladhvaniḥ |
mahāśūnyaṃ tadā yāti sarvasiddhisamāśrayam || 4.74 ||
translation_danish:
[4.74] I det tredje stadie bør en voldsom trommelyd erkendes,
hvorefter den trænger igennem til det store tomrum, hvor alle siddhier
findes.
translation_english: [4.74] In the third stage, the sound of a drum is known to arise in tie Sūnya between the eyebrows, and then the Vāyu goes to the Mahāśūnya, which is the home of all the siddhīs.

sanskrit:
चित्तानन्दं तदा जित्वा सहजानन्दसम्भवः ।
दोषदुःखजराव्याधिक्षुधानिद्राविवर्जितः ॥७५॥
transliteration:
cittānandaṃ tadā jitvā sahajānandasambhavaḥ |
doṣaduḥkhajarāvyādhikṣudhānidrāvivarjitaḥ || 4.75 ||
translation_danish:
[4.75] Efter at have overvundet sindets fryd bliver yogien fyldt med
spontan fryd og derved fri for dårligdom, lidelse, alderdom, sygdom,
sult og træthed.
Dette er fuldendelsestadiet Nispatti:
translation_english: [4.75] Conquering, then, the pleasures of the mind, ecstacy is spontaneously produced which is devoid of evils, pains, old age, disease, hunger and sleep.

sanskrit:
अथ निष्पत्त्यवस्था
रुद्रग्रन्थिं यदा भित्त्वा शर्वपीठगतोऽनिलः ।
निष्पत्तौ वैणवः शब्दः क्वणद्वीणाक्वणो भवेत् ॥७६॥
transliteration:
atha niṣpattyavasthā
rudragranthiṃ yadā bhittvā śarvapīṭhagato'nilaḥ |
niṣpattau vaiṇavaḥ śabdaḥ kvaṇadvīṇākvaṇo bhavet || 4.76 ||
translation_danish:
[4.76] Efter at have ødelagt Rudras[^212] knude, bevæger åndedrættet
sig til Śivas stol. I Nispatti vil der være en lyd af en fløjte og en
lyd af en vīṇā.[^213]
translation_english: [4.76] When the Rudra granthi is pierced and the air enters the seat of the Lord (the space between the eyebrows), then the perfect sound like that of a flute is produced.
footnotes_translation_danish:
[^212]: Rudra 'Den brølende', er en tidlig vedisk guddom, der senere er blevet identificeret med Śiva.
[^213]: Vīṇā refererer ofte til en indisk udgave af lutten med syv strenge, som spænder over to oktaver, men betegnelsen dækker også over en hel gruppe af strengeinstrumenter fra det indiske subkontinent.

sanskrit:
एकीभूतं तदा चित्तं राजयोगाभिधानकम् ।
सृष्टिसंहारकर्तासौ योगीश्वरसमो भवेत् ॥७७॥
transliteration:
ekībhūtaṃ tadā cittaṃ rājayogābhidhānakam |
sr̥ṣṭisaṃhārakartāsau yogīśvarasamo bhavet || 4.77 ||
translation_danish:
[4.77] Det tidspunkt, hvor sindet bliver samlet, kaldes rājayoga. Den
yogi, der skaber verden og ødelægger verden, må være lig Herren Śiva.
translation_english: [4.77] The union of the mind and the sound is called the Rāja-Yoga. The (real) Yogī becomes the creator and destroyer of the universe, like God.

sanskrit:
अस्तु वा मास्तु वा मुक्तिरत्रैवाखण्डितं सुखम् ।
लयोद्भवमिदं स्औख्यं राजयोगादवाप्यते ॥७८॥
transliteration:
astu vā māstu vā muktir atraivākhaṇḍitaṃ sukham |
layodbhavam idaṃ saukhyaṃ rājayogād avāpyate || 4.78 ||
translation_danish:
[4.78] Lad der være eller ikke være udfrielse; præcis her er der
uforstyrret lykke.
Denne lykke, der opstår af layayoga, er opnået gennem rājayoga.
translation_english: [4.78] Perpetual Happiness is achieved by this; I do not care if the mukti be not attained. This happiness, resulting from absorption [in Brahma], is obtained by means of Raja-Yoga.

sanskrit:
राजयोगमजानन्तः केवलं हठकर्मिणः ।
एतानभ्यासिनो मन्ये प्रयासफलवर्जितान् ॥७९॥
transliteration:
rājayogam ajānantaḥ kevalaṃ haṭhakarmiṇaḥ |
etān abhyāsino manye prayāsaphalavarjitān || 4.79 ||
translation_danish:
[4.79] Jeg anser dem, der alene praktiserer haṭhayoga uden kendskab
til rājayoga, som praktiserende, hvis anstrengelser er frugtesløse.
translation_english: [4.79] Those who are ignorant of the Rāja-Yoga and practise only the Haṭha-Yoga, will, in my opinion, waste their energy fruitlessly.

sanskrit:
उन्मन्यवाप्तये शीघ्रं भ्रूध्यानं मम सम्मतम् ।
राजयोगपदं प्राप्तुं सुखोपायोऽल्पचेतसाम् ।
सद्यः प्रत्ययसन्धायी जायते नादजो लयः ॥८०॥
transliteration:
unmanyavāptaye śīghraṃ bhrūdhyānaṃ mama sammatam |
rājayogapadaṃ prāptuṃ sukhopāyo'lpacetasām |
sadyaḥ pratyayasandhāyī jāyate nādajo layaḥ || 4.80 ||
translation_danish:
[4.80] Efter min opfattelse vil man hurtigt opnå Umanī-tilstanden ved
meditation mellem øjenbrynene. Meditationen er et godt middel til nemt
at opnå rājayoga-stadiet for dem med lav intelligens. Denne layayoga,
som er resultatet af nādayoga, afføder straks en yogi, der er i
meditationstilstanden Umanī.
translation_english: [4.80] Contemplation on the space between the eyebrows is, in my opinion, best for accomplishing soon the Unmanī state. For people of small intellect, it is a very easy method for obtaining perfection in the Raja-Yoga. The Laya produced by nāda, at once gives experience (of spiritual powers).

sanskrit:
नादानुसन्धानसमाधिभाजां योगीश्वराणां हृदि वर्धमानम् ।
आनन्दमेकं वचसामगम्यं जानाति तं श्रीगुरुनाथ एकः ॥८१॥
transliteration:
nādānusandhānasamādhibhājāṃ yogīśvarāṇāṃ hr̥di vardhamānam |
ānandam ekaṃ vacasām agamyaṃ jānāti taṃ śrīgurunātha ekaḥ || 4.81
translation_danish:
[4.81] En ubeskrivelig fryd vokser i hjertet hos yogiske mestre, der
er ét med samādhi gennem undersøgelse af indre lyd.[^214] En glorværdig
nātha guru véd dette.
translation_english: [4.81] The happiness which increases in the hearts of Yogiśwaras, who have gained success in Samādhi by means of attention to the nāda, is beyond description, and is known to Śri Gurū Nātha alone.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^214]: Nādānusandhāna, 'Undersøgelse af [indre] lyd'. I Haṭhapradīpika anvendes nādānusandhāna som et synonym for nādayoga (lydyoga).

sanskrit:
कर्णौ पिधाय हस्ताभ्यां यः शृणोति ध्वनिं मुनिः ।
तत्र चित्तं स्थिरीकुर्याद्यावत्स्थिरपदं व्रजेत् ॥८२॥
transliteration:
||
karṇau pidhāya hastābhyāṃ yaḥ śr̥ṇoti dhvaniṃ muniḥ |
tatra cittaṃ sthirīkuryād yāvat sthirapadaṃ vrajet || 4.82 ||
translation_danish:
[4.82] En muni bør fiksere sindet dér, hvor han hører en lyd, når han
dækker begge ører med hænderne, indtil sindet bliver roligt.
translation_english: [4.82] The sound which a muni hears by closing his ears with his fingers, should be heard attentively, till the mind becomes steady in it.

sanskrit:
अभ्यस्यमानो नादोऽयं बाह्यमावृणुते ध्वनिम् ।
पक्षाद्विक्षेपमखिलं जित्वा योगी सुखी भवेत् ॥८३॥
transliteration:
abhyasyamāno nādo'yaṃ bāhyam āvr̥ṇute dhvanim |
pakṣād vikṣepam akhilaṃ jitvā yogī sukhī bhavet || 4.83 ||
translation_danish:
[4.83] At praktisere denne nādayoga skjuler den ydre lyd. Efter at
have overvundet al distraktion i to uger bliver yogien glad.
translation_english: [4.83] By practising with this nāda, all other external sounds are stopped. The Yogī becomes happy by overcoming all distractions within 15 days.

sanskrit:
श्रूयते प्रथमाभ्यासे नादो नानाविधो महान् ।
ततोऽभ्यासे वर्धमाने श्रूयते सूक्ष्मसूक्ष्मकः ॥८४॥
transliteration:
śrūyate prathamābhyāse nādo nānāvidho mahān |
tato'bhyāse vardhamāne śrūyate sūkṣmasūkṣmakaḥ || 4.84 ||
translation_danish:
[4.84] I begyndelsen af praksissen høres mangfoldige høje lyde. Som
praksissen skrider frem, høres finere og finere lyde.
translation_english: [4.84] In the beginning, the sounds heard are of great variety and very loud; but, as the practice increases, they become more and more subtle.

sanskrit:
आदौ जलधिजीमूतभेरीझर्झरसम्भवाः ।
मध्ये मर्दलशङ्खोत्था घण्टाकाहलजास्तथा ॥८५॥
transliteration:
ādau jaladhijīmūtabherījharjharasaṃbhavāḥ |
madhye mardalaśaṅkhotthā ghaṇṭākāhalajās tathā || 4.85 ||
translation_danish:
[4.85] I begyndelsen opstår lyden af en flod, af torden, af en pauke
og af en jharjhara-tromme. I midten opstår lyden af en mardala-tromme og
en konkylieskal samt en lyd forårsaget af en klokke.
translation_english: [4.85] In the first stage, the sounds are surging, thundering like the beating of kettle drums and jingling ones. In the intermediate stage, they are like those produced by conch, Mridanga, bells, &c.

sanskrit:
अन्ते तु किङ्किणीवंशवीणाभ्रमरनिःस्वनाः ।
इति नानाविधा नादाः श्रूयन्ते देहमध्यगाः ॥८६॥
transliteration:
ante tu kiṅkiṇīvaṃśavīṇābhramaraniḥsvanāḥ |
iti nānāvidhā nādāḥ śrūyante dehamadhyagāḥ || 4.86 ||
translation_danish:
[4.86] Så til sidst en lille klokke, en fløjte, en vīṇā, en humlebi og
så stilhed. Således høres mangeartede lyde i midten af kroppen.
translation_english: [4.86] In the last stage, the sounds resemble those from tinklets, flute, Vīṇā, bee, &c. These various kinds of sounds are heard as being produced in the body.

sanskrit:
महति स्रूयमाणेऽपि मेघभेर्यादिके ध्वनौ ।
तत्र सूक्ष्मात्सूक्ष्मतरं नादमेव परामृशेत् ॥८७॥
transliteration:
mahati śrūyamāṇe'pi meghabheryādike dhvanau |
tatra sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataraṃ nādam eva parāmr̥śet || 4.87 ||
translation_danish:
[4.87] Selv når høje lyde af torden, en pauke og så videre høres, bør
yogien fokusere på en lyd, der bliver finere og finere.
translation_english: [4.87] Though hearing loud sounds like those of thunder, kettle drums, etc., one should practise with the subtle sounds also.

sanskrit:
घनमुत्सृज्य वा सूक्ष्मे सूक्ष्ममुत्सृज्य वा घने ।
रममाणमपि क्षिप्तं मनो नान्यत्र चालयेत् ॥८८॥
transliteration:
ghanam utsr̥jya vā sūkṣme sūkṣmam utsr̥jya vā ghane |
ramamāṇam api kṣiptaṃ mano nānyatra cālayet || 4.88 ||
translation_danish:
[4.88] Man skal ikke bevæge det hvilende sind andre steder hen,
hverken når det er fikseret i den fine lyd efter at have forladt den
grove lyd, eller når det er fikseret i den grove lyd efter at have
forladt den fine lyd.
translation_english: [4.88] Leaving the loudest, taking up the subtle one, and leaving the subtle one, taking up the loudest, thus practising, the distracted mind does not wander elsewhere.

sanskrit:
यत्रकुत्रापि वा नादे लगति प्रथमं मनः ।
तत्रैव सुस्थिरीभूय तेन सार्धं विलीयते ॥८९॥
transliteration:
yatra kutrāpi vā nāde lagati prathamaṃ manaḥ |
tatraiva susthirībhūya tena sārdhaṃ vilīyate || 4.89 ||
translation_danish:
[4.89] Uanset hvilken lyd sindet først fikseres i, finder det ro og
går i opløsning med lyden.
translation_english: [4.89] Wherever the mind attaches itself first, it becomes steady there; and then it becomes absorbed in it.

sanskrit:
मकरन्दं पिबन्भृङ्गो गन्धं नापेक्षते यथा ।
नादासक्तं तथा चित्तं विषयान्नहि काङ्क्षते ॥९०॥
transliteration:
makarandaṃ piban bhr̥ṅgo gandhaṃ nāpekṣate yathā |
nādāsaktaṃ tathā cittaṃ viṣayān nahi kāṅkṣate || 4.90 ||
translation_danish:
[4.90] Ligesom humlebien, der drikker honning, ikke bemærker blomstens
duft; ligeså er sindet, der er fikseret i indre lyd, ikke optaget af at
nyde ydre objekter.
translation_english: [4.90] Just as a bee, drinking sweet juice, does not care for the smell of the flower; so the mind, absorbed in the nāda, does not desire the objects of enjoyment.

sanskrit:
मनोमत्तगजेन्द्रस्य विषयोद्यानचारिणः ।
नियन्त्रणे समर्थोऽयं निनादनिशिताङ्कुशः ॥९१॥
transliteration:
manomattagajendrasya viṣayodyānacāriṇaḥ |
niyantraṇe samartho 'yaṃ ninādaniśitāṅkuśaḥ || 4.91 ||
translation_danish:
[4.91] Lydens spidse elefantkrog[^215] er egnet til at kontrollere et
sind, der rager rundt i de ydre tings have som en beruset elefantkonge.
translation_english: [4.91] The mind, like an elephant habituated to wander in the garden of enjoyments, is capable of being controlled by the sharp goad of anāhata nāda.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^215]: En elefantkrog er en stor jernkrog, der benyttes til at tæmme og dressere elefanter ved at ramme ømfindtlige steder på elefantkroppen og påføre smerte. Berusede elefanter er et farligt fænomen, der opstår, når vilde elefanter har spist rådden eller gæret frugt, som de bliver berusede af. Fulde elefanter kan ødelægge hele landsbyer i Sydasien. Her sammenlignes lydyoga (nāda) metaforisk med en sådan elefantkrog, der kan tæmme det vilde sind.

sanskrit:
बद्धं तु नादबन्धेन मनः संत्यक्तचापलम् ।
प्रयाति सुतरां स्थैर्यं छिन्नपक्षः खगो यथा ॥९२॥
transliteration:
baddhaṃ tu nādabandhena manaḥ saṃtyaktacāpalam |
prayāti sutarāṃ sthairyaṃ chinnapakṣaḥ khago yathā || 4.92 ||
translation_danish:
[4.92] Sindet, bundet af lydens bånd og løst af sin urolighed, bliver
ubevægelig som en fugl med afskårne vinger.
translation_english: [4.92] The mind, captivated in the snare of nāda, gives up all its activity; and, like a bird with clipped wings, becomes calm at once.

sanskrit:
सर्वचिन्तां परित्यज्य सावधानेन चेतसा ।
नाद एवानुसन्धेयो योगसाम्राज्यमिच्छता ॥९३॥
transliteration:
sarvacintāṃ parityajya sāvadhānena cetasā |
nāda evānusandheyo yogasāmrājyam icchatā || 4.93 ||
translation_danish:
[4.93] Den, der ønsker at mestre alle former for yoga, skal undersøge
nāda med et koncentreret sind efter at have kastet alle tanker bort.
translation_english: [4.93] Those desirous of the kingdom of Yoga, should take up the practice of hearing the anāhata nāda, with mind collected and free from all cares.

sanskrit:
नादोन्तरङ्गसारङ्गबन्धने वागुरायते ।
अन्तरङ्गकुरङ्गस्य वधे व्याधायतेऽपि च​ ॥९४॥
transliteration:
nādontaraṅgasāraṅgabandhane[^216] vāgurāyate |
antaraṅgakuraṅgasya vadhe vyādhāyate'pi ca || 4.94 ||
translation_danish:
[4.94] Nādayoga spreder et net ud for at fange sindets antelope. Derpå
bliver den jægeren, der dræber sindets antelope.
translation_english: [4.94] Nada is the snare for catching the mind; and, when it is caught like a deer, it can be killed also like it.
footnotes_transliteration: [^216]: GRETIL har nādo 'ntaraṅgasāraṅgabandhane med korrekt sandhi (avagrāha).

sanskrit:
अन्तरङ्गस्य यमिनो वाजिनः परिधायते ।
नादोपास्तिरतो नित्यमवधार्या हि योगिना ॥९५॥
transliteration:
antaraṅgasya yamino vājinaḥ paridhāyate |
nādopāstir ato nityam avadhāryā hi yoginā || 4.95 ||
translation_danish:
[4.95] Tilbedelsen af lyd tøjler sindets hingst. Lyd bør derfor
vedvarende kontempleres af yogien.
translation_english: [4.95] Nāda is the bolt of the stable door for the horse (the minds of the Yogīs). A Yogī should determine to practise constantly in the hearing of the nāda sounds.

sanskrit:
बद्धं विमुक्तचाञ्चल्यं नादगन्धकजारणात् ।
मनः पारदमाप्नोति निरालम्बाख्यखेऽटनम् ॥९६॥
transliteration:
baddhaṃ vimuktacāñcalyaṃ nādagandhakajāraṇāt |
manaḥ pāradam āpnoti nirālambākhyakhe'ṭanam || 4.96 ||
translation_danish:
[4.96] Bundet og udfriet af ustabiliteten, opnår sindet tilstanden af
kviksølv fra mødet med lydens svovl og bevæger sig frit i det
selvopretholdende brahman.
translation_english: [4.96] Mind gets the properties of calcined mercury. When deprived of its unsteadiness it is calcined, combined with the sulphur of nāda, and then it roams like it in tine supportless ākāśa or Brahma.

sanskrit:
नादश्रवणतः क्षिप्रमन्तरङ्गभुजङ्गमः ।
विस्मृत्य सर्वमेकाग्रः कुत्रचिन्नहि धावति ॥९७॥
transliteration:
nādaśravaṇataḥ kṣipram antaraṅgabhujaṅgamaḥ |
vismr̥tya sarvam ekāgraḥ kutracin nahi dhāvati || 4.97 ||
translation_danish:
[4.97] Når sindets dæmoniske slange hører den indre lyd, glemmer den
hurtigt alt. Den bliver koncentreret om én ting og kryber ikke
andetsteds hen.
translation_english: [4.97] The mind is like a serpent, forgetting all its unsteadiness by hearing the nāda, it does not run away anywhere.

sanskrit:
काष्ठे प्रवर्तितो वह्निः काष्ठेन सह शाम्यति ।
नादे प्रवर्तितं चित्तं नादेन सह लीयते ॥९८॥
transliteration:
kāṣṭhe pravartito vahniḥ kāṣṭhena saha śāmyati |
nāde pravartitaṃ cittaṃ nādena saha līyate || 4.98 ||
translation_danish:
[4.98] En ild antændt i brændet ophører sammen med brændet. Et
opildnet sind opløses i lyden sammen med lyden.
translation_english: [4.98] The fire, catching firewood, is extinguished along with it (after burning it up); and so the mind also, working with the nāda, becomes latent along with it.

sanskrit:
घण्टादिनादसक्तस्तब्धान्तःकरणहरिणस्य ​।
प्रहरणमपि सुकरं शरसन्धानप्रवीणश्चेत् ॥९९॥
transliteration:
ghaṇṭādinādasaktastabdhāntaḥkaraṇahariṇasya |
praharaṇam api sukaraṃ śarasandhānapravīṇaś cet || 4.99 ||
translation_danish:
[4.99] Når sindets antelope er hypnotiseret af lyden af en klokke
eller lignende, er den let at ramme for den, der er øvet i at sigte med
pil.
translation_english: [4.99] The antahkaraṇa (mind), like a deer, becomes absorbed and motionless on hearing the sound of hells, etc.; and then it is very easy for an expert archer to kill it.

sanskrit:
अनाहतस्य शब्दस्य ध्वनिर्य उपलभ्यते ।
ध्वनेरन्तर्गतं ज्ञेयं ज्ञेयस्यान्तर्गतं मनः ।
मनस्तत्र लयं याति तद्विष्णोः परमं पदम् ॥१००॥
transliteration:
anāhatasya śabdasya dhvanir ya upalabhyate |
dhvaner antargataṃ jñeyaṃ jñeyasyāntargataṃ manaḥ |
manas tatra layaṃ yāti tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam || 4.100 ||
translation_danish:
[4.100] Genklangen af en lydløs lyd høres. Erkendelsen indgår i
genklangen og sindet indgår i erkendelsen, og dér opløses sindet. Dette
er Viṣṇus højeste stade.
translation_english: [4.100] The knowable interpenetrates the anāhata sound which is heard, and the mind interpenetrates the knowable. The mind becomes absorbed there, which is the seat of the all-pervading, almighty Lord.

sanskrit:
तावदाकाशसङ्कल्पो यावच्छब्दः प्रवर्तते ।
निःशब्दं तत्परं ब्रह्म परमात्मेति गीयते ॥१०१॥
transliteration:
tāvad ākāśasaṅkalpo yāvac chabdaḥ pravartate |
niḥśabdaṃ tatparaṃ brahma paramātmeti gīyate || 4.101 ||
translation_danish:
[4.101] Så længe der er lyd, så længe består oplevelsen af rum.
Stilhed siges at være den højeste form for brahman og den højeste form
for ātman.
translation_english: [4.101] So long as the sounds continue, there is the idea of ākāśa. When they disappear, then it is called Para Brahma, Paramātmana.

sanskrit:
यत्किञ्चिन्नादरूपेण श्रूयते शक्तिरेव सा ।
यस्तत्त्वान्तो निराकारः स एव परमेश्वरः ॥१०२॥
transliteration:
yat kiñcin nādarūpeṇa śrūyate śaktir eva sā |
yas tattvānto nirākāraḥ sa eva parameśvaraḥ || 4.102 ||
translation_danish:
[4.102] Hvad end der høres i form af nāda, det er śakti. Han, som er
den formløse og enden på alle elementer, er i sandhed den højeste Herre.
Således slutter udforskningen af den indre lyd.
translation_english: [4.102] Whatever is heard in the form of nāda, is the śakti (power). That which is formless, the final state of the Tatwas, is tile Parameśwara.

sanskrit:
इति नादानुसन्धानाम
सर्वे हठलयोपाया राजयोगस्य सिद्धये ।
राजयोगसमारूढः पुरुषः कालवञ्चकः ॥१०३॥
transliteration:
iti nādānusandhānam
sarve haṭhalayopāyā rājayogasya siddhaye |
rājayogasamārūḍhaḥ puruṣaḥ kālavañcakaḥ || 4.103 ||
translation_danish:
[4.103] Alle haṭhayogaens og layayogaens metoder sigter mod rājayogas
fuldendelse. Et menneske, som har fuldendt rājayoga, snyder tiden.[^218]
translation_english: [4.103] All the methods of Haṭha are meant for gaining success in the Raja-Yoga; for, the man, who is well-established in the Raja-Yoga, overcomes death.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^218]: Kālavañcaka, 'snyde tiden'. Et yogisk udtryk for at overvinde døden.

sanskrit:
तत्त्वं बीजं हठः क्षेत्रमौदासीन्यं जलं त्रिभिः ।
उन्मनी कल्पलतिका सद्य एव प्रवर्तते ॥१०४॥
transliteration:
tattvaṃ bījaṃ haṭhaḥ kṣetram audāsīnyaṃ jalaṃ tribhiḥ |
unmanī kalpalatikā sadya eva pravartate || 4.104 ||
translation_danish:
[4.104] Det virkelige[^219] er frøet, haṭhayoga er mulden, og
uanfægtelighed er vandet. Af disse tre fremspirer Unmanī-tilstanden, den
ønskeopfyldende slyngplante, straks.
translation_english: [4.104] Tatwa is the seed, Haṭha the field; and Indifference (Vairāgya) the water. By the action of these three, the creeper Unmanī thrives very rapidly.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^219]: Tattva, 'det virkelige, essensen', kan også være en reference til sindet i denne kontekst.

sanskrit:
सदा नादानुसन्धानात्क्षीयन्ते पापस​ञ्चयाः ।
निरञ्जने विलीयेते निश्चितं चित्तमारुतौ ॥१०५॥
transliteration:
sadā nādānusandhānāt kṣīyante pāpasañcayāḥ |
nirañjane vilīyete niścitaṃ cittamārutau || 4.105 ||
translation_danish:
[4.105] Ophobningen af moralsk urenhed tilintetgøres altid ved
undersøgelsen af den indre lyd. Sindet og åndedrættet opløses
fuldstændigt i det pletfrie.[^220]
translation_english: [4.105] All the accumulations of sins are destroyed by practising always with the nāda; and the mind and the airs do certainly become latent in the colorless (Paramātmana).
footnotes_translation_danish: [^220]: Nirañjana, 'pletfri', kan være en reference til den yderste realitet eller det højeste væsen, personificeret som guden Śiva.

sanskrit:
शङ्खदुन्धुभिनादं च न शृणोति[^217] कदाचन ।
काष्ठवज्जायते देह उन्मन्यावस्थया ध्रुवम् ॥१०६॥
transliteration:
śaṅkhadundhubhinādaṃ ca na śr̥ṇoti kadācana |
kāṣṭhavaj jāyate deha unmanyāvasthayā dhruvam || 4.106 ||
translation_danish:
[4.106] Og yogien hører ikke længere lyden af hverken konkylie eller
pauke.
Når Unmanī-tilstanden opstår, forbliver kroppen urokkelig som et træ.
translation_english: [4.106] Such a one. does not hear the noise of the conch and Dundubhi. Being in the Unmanī avasthā, his body becomes like a piece of wood.
footnotes_sanskrit: [^217]: Her læser vi śr̥ṇoti (GRETIL) i stedet for śrr̥ṇoti (Lonāvlā).

sanskrit:
सर्वावस्थाविनिर्मुक्तः सर्वचिन्ताविवर्जितः ।
मृतवत्तिष्ठते योगी स मुक्तो नात्र संशयः ॥१०७॥
transliteration:
sarvāvasthāvinirmuktaḥ sarvacintāvivarjitaḥ |
mr̥tavat tiṣṭhate yogī sa mukto nātra saṃśayaḥ || 4.107 ||
translation_danish:
[4.107] Yogien udfries af alle tilstande og af alle tanker og bliver
som død. Han er udfriet - herom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [4.107] There is no doubt, such a Yogī becomes free from all states, from all cares, and remains like one dead.

sanskrit:
खाद्यते न च कालेन बाध्यते न च कर्मणा ।
साध्यते न स केनापि योगी युक्तः समाधिना ॥१०८॥
transliteration:
khādyate na ca kālena bādhyate na ca karmaṇā |
sādhyate na sa kenāpi yogī yuktaḥ samādhinā || 4.108 ||
translation_danish:
[4.108] En yogi forankret i samādhi ædes ikke af tiden, bindes ikke af
karma og overvindes ikke af nogen.
translation_english: [4.108] He is not devoured by death, is not bound by his actions. The Yogī who is engaged in Samādhi is overpowered by none.

sanskrit:
न गन्धं न रसं रूपं न च स्पर्शं न निःस्वनम् ।
नात्मानं न परं वेत्ति योगी युक्तः समाधिना ॥१०९॥
transliteration:
na gandhaṃ na rasaṃ rūpaṃ na ca sparśaṃ na niḥsvanam |
nātmānaṃ na paraṃ vetti yogī yuktaḥ samādhinā || 4.109 ||
translation_danish:
[4.109] En yogi forankret i samādhi kender ikke mere lugt, smag,
synlig form, berøring, lyd, sig selv eller en anden.
translation_english: [4.109] The Yogī, engaged in Samādhi, feels neither smell, taste, color, touch, sound, nor is conscious of his own self.

sanskrit:
चित्तं न सुप्तं नो जाग्रत्स्मृतिविस्मृतिवर्जितम् ।
न चास्तमेति नोदेति यस्यासौ मुक्त एव सः ॥११०॥
transliteration:
cittaṃ na suptaṃ no jāgrat smr̥tivismr̥tivarjitam |
na cāstam eti nodeti yasyāsau mukta eva saḥ || 4.110 ||
translation_danish:
[4.110] Han, hvis sind hverken er vågent eller sovende, husker eller
glemmer, han hverken dør eller genfødes. Han er sandelig udfriet.
translation_english: [4.110] He whose mind is neither sleeping, waking, remembering, destitute of memory, disappearing nor appearing, is liberated.

sanskrit:
न विजानाति शीतोष्णं न दुःखं न सुखं तथा ।
न मानं नापमानं च योगी युक्तः समाधिना ॥१११॥
transliteration:
na vijānāti śītoṣṇaṃ na duḥkhaṃ na sukhaṃ tathā |
na mānaṃ nāpamānaṃ ca yogī yuktaḥ samādhinā || 4.111 ||
translation_danish:
[4.111] En yogi forankret i samādhi kender ikke mere kulde og varme,
glæde og smerte, ære og vanære.
translation_english: [4.111] He feels neither heat, cold, pain, pleasure, respect nor disrespect. Such a Yogī is absorbed in Samādhi.

sanskrit:
स्वस्थो जाग्रदवस्थायां सुप्तवद्योऽवतिष्ठते ।
निःश्वासोच्छ्वासहीनश्च निश्चितं मुक्त एव सः ॥११२॥
transliteration:
svastho jāgrad avasthāyāṃ suptavad yo'vatiṣṭhate |
niḥśvāsocchvāsahīnaś ca niścitaṃ mukta eva saḥ || 4.112 ||
translation_danish:
[4.112] Han, som er fast forankret i sig selv, vågen, men i en
søvnlignende tilstand, uden indånding og udånding, han er sandelig
udfriet.
translation_english: [4.112] He who, though awake, appears like one sleeping, and is without inspiration and expiration, is certainly free.

sanskrit:
अवध्यः सर्वशस्त्राणामशक्यः सर्वदेहिनाम् ।
अग्राह्यो मन्त्रयन्त्राणां योगी युक्तः समाधिना ॥११३॥
transliteration:
avadhyaḥ sarvaśastrāṇām aśakyaḥ sarvadehinām |
agrāhyo mantrayantrāṇāṃ yogī yuktaḥ samādhinā || 4.113 ||
translation_danish:
[4.113] En yogi forankret i samādhi kan ikke dræbes af noget våben,
kan ikke overvindes af noget levende væsen og kan ikke beherskes af
noget mantra eller yantra.[^221]
translation_english: [4.113] The Yogī, engaged in Samādhi, cannot be killed by any instrument, and is beyond the controlling power of beings. He is beyond the reach of incantations and charms.
footnotes_translation_danish: [^221]: Mantra, 'magisk formular' og yantra, 'magisk diagram', som i nogle sammenhænge - som her - kan anvendelse som 'sort magi' til at få magt over andre og kontrollere dem.

sanskrit:
यावन्नैव प्रविशति चरन्मारुतो मध्यमार्गे
यावद्बिन्दुर्न भवति दृढः प्राणवातप्रबन्धात् ।
यावद्ध्याने सहजसदृशं जायते नैव तत्त्वं
तावज्ज्ञानं वदति तदिदं दम्भमिथ्याप्रलापः ॥११४॥
इति सहजानन्दसन्तानचिन्तामणिस्वात्मारामयोगिन्द्रविरचितायां हठप्रदीपिकायां
समाधिलक्षणं नाम चतुर्थोपदेशः
transliteration:
yāvan naiva praviśati caran māruto madhyamārge
yāvad bindur na bhavati dr̥ḍhaḥ prāṇavātaprabandhāt |
yāvad dhyāne sahajasadr̥śaṃ jāyate naiva tattvaṃ
tāvaj jñānaṃ vadati tad idaṃ dambhamithyāpralāpaḥ || 4.114 ||
iti sahajānandasantānacintāmaṇisvātmārāmayogindraviracitāyām
haṭhapradīpikāyāṃ samādhilakṣaṇaṃ nāma caturthopadeśaḥ
translation_danish:
[4.114] Så længe det strømmende åndedræt ikke trænger ind i den
midterste kanal, så længe sæden ikke fastholdes af prāṇaens vind, så
længe virkeligheden ikke fremstår i sin sande form i meditationen -
indtil da - er al tale om visdom bedragerisk vranglære!
Således slutter fjerde belæring i Haṭhapradīpikā ved navn 'Samādhis
kendetegn' udarbejdet af Svātmarāma Yogendra fra Sahajānanda
Cintāmani-successionen.
translation_english: [4.114] As long as the Prāṇa does not enter and flow in the middle channel and the vindu does not become firm by the control of the movements of the Prāṇa; as long as the mind does not assume the form of Brahma without any effort in contemplation, so long all the talk of knowledge and wisdom is merely the nonsensical babbling of a mad man.
